summary.en: Buy most commonly means to purchase something with money, and in informal English it can also mean to believe or accept an idea.
summary.zh: Buy 最常见是“购买”，在口语中也常表示“相信/接受某种说法”。

definition.en: to get something by paying money for it; to purchase
definition.zh: 付钱获得某物；购买

examples.en: I want to buy a new phone.
examples.zh: 我想买一部新手机。

examples.en: She bought some bread on her way home.
examples.zh: 她回家路上买了些面包。

definition.en: to accept or believe an idea or story (often used in negatives); to be convinced
definition.zh: 相信（某个说法/故事，常用于否定）；被说服

examples.en: I don’t buy that excuse.
examples.zh: 我不相信那个借口。

examples.en: Do you really buy his story?
examples.zh: 你真的相信他的说法吗？

definition.en: to obtain something through effort, sacrifice, or consequences (often with an abstract noun)
definition.zh: 以努力/代价换来（某结果，常接抽象名词）

examples.en: His lies bought him time, but not trust.
examples.zh: 他的谎言为他争取了时间，但换不来信任。

examples.en: Hard work can buy you opportunities.
examples.zh: 努力可以为你赢得机会。

extraExplanation: “buy”在口语里很常见的延伸义是“相信/接受”（I don’t buy it.），语气通常带怀疑或不认同。
相关固定搭配：buy time（争取时间）、buy into（认同/接受某观点或体系）、buy someone off（收买某人让其闭嘴或改变立场，偏负面）。

summary.en: very cheaply; at a bargain price
summary.zh: 非常便宜地；以超划算的价格

definition.en: to buy something very cheaply (for much less than its real value)
definition.zh: 以非常便宜的价格买到（远低于真实价值）

examples.en: She bought the antique chair for a song at a yard sale.
examples.zh: 她在庭院旧货甩卖上用很便宜的价格买到了那把古董椅。

examples.en: We got the apartment for a song because the owner needed to rent it out quickly.
examples.zh: 因为房东急着出租，我们几乎是白菜价租到了那套公寓。

examples.en: He said he bought the car for a song, but it still needed repairs.
examples.zh: 他说那辆车买得很便宜，但还是需要修理。

etymology: 源自英语中“song（歌）”象征“微不足道的小代价”，表达“便宜到像只付出一首歌那么轻”。该用法在口语中沿用至今。
mnemonic: 把“for a song”想成“只要唱首歌就能换到”，强调“便宜得离谱”。
联想中文“白菜价/捡漏”：用很小的代价买到很值的东西。

summary.en: purchase suddenly without planning
summary.zh: 未计划的冲动购买

definition.en: to buy something suddenly without planning, because you feel a strong momentary desire
definition.zh: 一时冲动（没计划）就买下某物

examples.en: I went in for toothpaste but bought a candle on impulse.
examples.zh: 我本来进去买牙膏，却一时冲动买了个蜡烛。

examples.en: She bought the dress on impulse and regretted it later.
examples.zh: 她一时冲动买了那条裙子，后来后悔了。

examples.en: Don’t buy things on impulse—sleep on it first.
examples.zh: 别冲动消费——先想一晚再决定。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：buy something on impulse（冲动购买某物）。也可以说 impulse buy（名词/动词短语：一次冲动消费/冲动购买）。
语境提示：在商场、直播带货、打折促销等场景里很常用；表达通常带一点“没想清楚就买了”的后悔或自嘲语气。
etymology: impulse 来自拉丁语 impulse（“推动、驱使”），引申为“突然的强烈念头/冲动”。on impulse 表示“受冲动驱使地”。
mnemonic: impulse≈“一股冲劲儿”。想象“被一股力推着（push）去买”，就是冲动消费。
on impulse=“靠冲动在行动”。把 on 理解成“在……状态下”。

summary.en: to pay to take over someone’s ownership or to end an agreement early
summary.zh: 付钱取得对方的全部权益，或买断合同提前终止

definition.en: to purchase all of someone’s shares or ownership in a business so that they no longer have any control or stake
definition.zh: 买下某人持有的全部股份/产权，使其退出、不再拥有控制权或权益

examples.en: The company bought out its smaller competitor.
examples.zh: 这家公司买下了规模较小的竞争对手。

examples.en: She bought him out of the partnership after years of disagreement.
examples.zh: 多年争执后，她买下了他在合伙企业中的份额，让他退出。

examples.en: The founders refused an offer to be bought out.
examples.zh: 创始人拒绝了被收购/被买断的提议。

definition.en: to pay someone a sum of money to end a contract, obligation, or claim early
definition.zh: 付钱提前终止合同/义务/权利主张（买断、解约）

examples.en: He bought out his lease and moved to another city.
examples.zh: 他买断了租约，搬去了另一个城市。

examples.en: The studio bought the actor out of the agreement.
examples.zh: 制片方出钱让演员提前解除合约。

extraExplanation: 用法提示：buy sb out / buy out sb 都可以，但更常见的是把人放中间：buy someone out（买下某人的份额）。
常见搭配：buy out a partner（买断合伙人）、management buyout / MBO（管理层收购）。
etymology: 由 buy（购买）+ out（把对方“买出去”、让其退出）构成的动词短语；在商业语境中逐渐固定为“买断股份/收购使退出”的含义。
mnemonic: 把 out 理解成“出局/退出”：用钱把对方买到“出局”＝买断。
联想“出钱让人出门”：buy（买）+ out（出去）→ 付钱让对方退出/离开合同或股份。

summary.en: purchase something for a very low price
summary.zh: 以很低的价格买到（捡到便宜）

definition.en: to buy something at a very low price (a good deal), often because it is discounted or cheaper than usual
definition.zh: 以很低的价格买到东西（买到划算的便宜货），通常因为打折或比平时更便宜

examples.en: I bought a bargain at the outlet store—this jacket was half off.
examples.zh: 我在奥特莱斯买到一件很划算的便宜货——这件夹克打了五折。

examples.en: She loves to buy a bargain when the shops have end-of-season sales.
examples.zh: 她很喜欢在换季清仓时买到便宜又划算的东西。

examples.en: If you compare prices online, you can often buy a bargain.
examples.zh: 如果你在网上比价，常常能买到很划算的东西。

extraExplanation: 在英美语境中，买到“bargain”常和打折季（sale）、清仓（clearance）、奥特莱斯（outlet）、二手店/旧货店（thrift store）等场景相关。
注意：英语里更常说“get a bargain”或“find a bargain”；“buy a bargain”也对，但使用频率稍低。
etymology: “bargain”来自中古英语，源自古法语，原义与“讨价还价、交易协定”有关；后来引申为“便宜划算的商品/好交易”。“buy a bargain”就是“买到一笔划算的交易”。
mnemonic: 把“bargain”联想成“bar(吧台) + gain(赚到)”：在“吧台价/特价”里“赚到”了，=买到划算的。
记搭配：bargain = 便宜货/划算；buy/get/find a bargain = 买到/捡到便宜。

summary.en: purchase a home using a home loan
summary.zh: 用房贷买房

definition.en: to purchase a house using a mortgage loan (borrowing money from a bank and repaying over time)
definition.zh: 通过按揭贷款买房（向银行借钱买房，之后分期还款）

examples.en: They bought a house on mortgage because they didn’t have enough savings for the full price.
examples.zh: 他们通过按揭买房，因为存款不够一次性付清房款。

examples.en: It can be risky to buy a house on mortgage if your income is unstable.
examples.zh: 如果收入不稳定，通过按揭买房可能有风险。

examples.en: She plans to buy a house on mortgage and pay it off in 30 years.
examples.zh: 她打算按揭买房，用30年还清贷款。

synonyms: buy a house with a mortgage
extraExplanation: 更地道的说法常见于：“buy a house with a mortgage”或“buy a house on a mortgage”。也可以说“take out a mortgage (on a house)”=“办理/申请房贷”。
在美国语境里，常见期限有15年或30年；每月还款通常包含本金、利息，很多情况下还可能包含房产税和房屋保险（取决于贷款与托管安排）。
etymology: “mortgage”源自中古法语，来自“mort”（死亡）+“gage”（抵押/担保），原意类似“死抵押”：若借款人到期未还，抵押权就“生效”；还清则抵押权“消亡”。“on mortgage”表示“以按揭方式/靠按揭贷款”。
mnemonic: mort（死）+ gage（抵押）→“死抵押”→联想到“不还就把房子抵押给银行”。
把“mortgage”记成“more + gauge（更多的压力表）”：房贷越多，压力表越高（谐记法，仅帮助记忆）。

word: buy a pig in a poke

summary.en: Buying or agreeing without checking first.
summary.zh: 不先核实就购买或同意。

definition.en: To buy or accept something without inspecting it first, often risking being cheated or disappointed.
definition.zh: 未看清或未核实就购买/接受某物，往往有上当或失望的风险。

examples.en: Don’t buy a used car online without seeing it—don’t buy a pig in a poke.
examples.zh: 二手车不看实物就网购太冒险了——别“没看清就买”。

examples.en: He signed the contract without reading it, basically buying a pig in a poke.
examples.zh: 他没看合同就签了，基本就是“没看清就买”。

examples.en: Ordering expensive electronics from an unknown seller can feel like buying a pig in a poke.
examples.zh: 从不知名卖家买贵重电子产品，感觉就像“没看清就买”。

extraExplanation: poke 在现代英语里较少用作“袋子”，但在这个固定说法里仍保留旧义。
这个典故也常被认为和 let the cat out of the bag（泄露秘密/露馅）有关：如果你打开袋子，发现不是猪而是猫，就“露馅”了。
etymology: 源自中世纪欧洲集市用语：poke 指“袋子”（古法语/中古英语中常见）。有人把猪仔装进袋里卖给买家；若买家不打开检查，可能被换成猫等更便宜的东西，于是引申为“未检查就购买”。
mnemonic: 把 poke 记成“口袋/袋子”（可联想中文“口袋”的“袋”）：猪在袋子里，看不到就买=容易被骗。
想象买回家打开袋子才发现不是猪——立刻懂“没检查就买”的后果。

word: buy a special cream in chemist's

summary.en: purchase a medicated or specific cream at a pharmacy
summary.zh: 在药房购买特定/药用乳膏

definition.en: to purchase a particular (often medicated) cream from a pharmacy (especially in British English: “the chemist’s”)
definition.zh: 在药房（英式英语常说“the chemist’s”）购买一种特定的（常为药用的）乳膏/药膏

examples.en: I need to buy a special cream at the chemist’s for my rash.
examples.zh: 我需要去药房买一种治疗皮疹的特效药膏。

examples.en: You can buy a special cream from the chemist’s without a prescription.
examples.zh: 你可以在药房买到这种特效药膏，不用处方。

examples.en: She went to the chemist’s to buy a special cream for dry skin.
examples.zh: 她去药房买了一种治疗皮肤干燥的专用乳霜。

synonyms: get a cream at the pharmacy
buy a cream at the drugstore
pick up a cream from the chemist’s
phonetic: /baɪ ə ˈspɛʃəl kriːm ɪn ðə ˈkɛmɪsts/
extraExplanation: 更自然的表达通常是：buy a special cream at the chemist’s / from the chemist’s。
美式英语更常说：buy a special cream at the drugstore / pharmacy。
注意：chemists（复数）= 化学家；the chemist’s（所有格）= 药房/药店（省略了shop）。
etymology: “chemist’s”在英式英语中常指“药房/药店”，来源于早期药剂师与化学家职业界限不如现在清晰；因此“at/from the chemist’s”就表示“在/从药房”。
mnemonic: 记忆法：chemist’s 里有 ’s（所有格），可理解为“药剂师的店”→ 药房。

summary.en: purchase a storybook
summary.zh: 购买故事书

definition.en: to purchase a book that contains stories (often fiction, for children or for leisure reading)
definition.zh: 买一本故事书（通常指小说类或儿童读物，用于休闲阅读）

examples.en: I want to buy a story book for my little sister.
examples.zh: 我想给我妹妹买一本故事书。

examples.en: Let’s buy a story book and read it together tonight.
examples.zh: 我们买一本故事书，今晚一起读吧。

examples.en: Where can I buy a story book in English?
examples.zh: 我在哪里可以买到英文故事书？

extraExplanation: “story book / storybook”常指给孩子读的图画故事书或短篇故事集；如果是长篇小说，更常说“novel”。
在口语里你也可以说：“buy a storybook”。两种写法都常见。
etymology: 这是由动词短语“buy”（购买）+ 名词短语“a story book”（一本故事书）组成的日常表达。“storybook”也常写作一个词；写成“story book”更强调“故事类的书”。
mnemonic: 把“story（故事）+ book（书）”直接拼起来记：故事 + 书 = 故事书。
“buy”发音像“拜”，联想“拜托我去买（buy）一本故事书”。

summary.en: purchase a serving of ice cream
summary.zh: 买一份冰淇淋

definition.en: to purchase a serving of ice cream
definition.zh: 买一份冰淇淋（买一支/一个/一杯冰淇淋）

examples.en: Let’s buy an ice cream after dinner.
examples.zh: 我们晚饭后去买一份冰淇淋吧。

examples.en: He bought an ice cream for his little sister.
examples.zh: 他给妹妹买了一份冰淇淋。

examples.en: I’m going to buy an ice cream at the corner store.
examples.zh: 我打算去街角的小店买一份冰淇淋。

extraExplanation: 用法提示：如果强调“冰淇淋这种东西/一些冰淇淋”，更常说 some ice cream / a little ice cream；如果强调“买一份/一个（如一支甜筒、一杯）”，就可以说 buy an ice cream。
更自然的点单说法：I’ll have a cone/cup, please.（我要一个甜筒/一杯。）
etymology: 由动词 buy（购买）+ 名词短语 an ice cream（“一份冰淇淋”）组成。在日常英语中，ice cream 既可作不可数名词（强调“冰淇淋这种食物”），也可用 a/an 表示“一份/一个单位的冰淇淋”。
mnemonic: 把 an ice cream 理解成“一个单位的冰淇淋”（一支/一个甜筒/一杯），就像 an apple（一个苹果）。
联想：buy=“掏钱买”，ice cream=“冰+奶油”，画面感很强：掏钱买到一份冰淇淋。

summary.en: purchase books
summary.zh: 购买书籍

definition.en: to purchase books (in a store or online)
definition.zh: 买书；购买书籍（在线上或实体店）

examples.en: I usually buy books online because they’re cheaper.
examples.zh: 我通常在网上买书，因为更便宜。

examples.en: She bought books for her new course.
examples.zh: 她为新课程买了书。

examples.en: Where do you buy books in this city?
examples.zh: 在这座城市你一般去哪儿买书？

definition.en: used as an instruction or suggestion (often in ads or recommendations) to purchase books
definition.zh: （常用于广告或推荐语中）用来表示“去买书/买书吧”的建议或指令

examples.en: Support local stores—buy books from independent bookstores.
examples.zh: 支持本地商店——去独立书店买书。

examples.en: If you want to learn faster, buy books with exercises.
examples.zh: 如果你想学得更快，就买带练习的书。

extraExplanation: 在英语里，“buy + 物品”是最常见的购买表达：buy a book / buy books。想强调“从哪里买”，常用 buy books from + 地点/商家（如 from Amazon / from a bookstore）。想强调“为谁买”，用 buy books for + 人（如 for my sister）。
etymology: “buy”源自古英语，原义与“支付、交换”有关；“book”源自古英语，指“书、书卷”。两词组合成常见动词短语，意思直观：购买书籍。
mnemonic: 把它当成固定搭配记：buy（买）+ books（书）= 买书。
联想中文场景：开学/备考要“buy books”，就像“买教材”。

word: buy for the sake of buying

summary.en: shopping without real need, driven by the urge to buy
summary.zh: 并非出于需要、而是被“想买”的冲动驱动的购物

definition.en: to purchase things without needing them, simply because you enjoy shopping or feel an urge to buy
definition.zh: 为了买而买；并非出于需要，而是因为想买、爱逛或冲动消费

examples.en: I used to buy for the sake of buying, but now I wait 24 hours before I check out.
examples.zh: 我以前总是为了买而买，但现在我会在结账前等24小时。

examples.en: When she’s stressed, she buys for the sake of buying and ends up with things she never uses.
examples.zh: 她压力大时就会为了买而买，结果买了一堆从来不用的东西。

examples.en: The ad encourages people to buy for the sake of buying, not because the product solves a real problem.
examples.zh: 这则广告鼓励人们为了买而买，而不是因为产品真正解决了问题。

extraExplanation: 常用于讨论“消费主义（consumerism）”“冲动购物（impulse buying）”或“情绪性消费（retail therapy）”。语气多带批评或自我反省。
“for the sake of”表示“为了……本身/出于……的缘故”。所以整个短语的重点是：买东西不是为了解决需求，而是为了满足“想买”的感觉。
etymology: 由动词短语“buy”（购买）+ 固定表达“for the sake of …”（为了……本身；出于……的缘故）构成，强调动机不是“需要”，而是“买这件事本身”。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：for the sake of = “为了……本身”。所以 buy for the sake of buying = “为了买这件事而买”。
联想中文：像“为了吃而吃/为了刷而刷”，强调行为本身成了目的。

summary.en: purchase home or office furnishings
summary.zh: 购买家用或办公家具

definition.en: to purchase items such as chairs, tables, beds, or sofas for a home or office
definition.zh: 购买家具（如椅子、桌子、床、沙发等），用于家里或办公室

examples.en: We’re going to buy furniture for our new apartment this weekend.
examples.zh: 我们这周末要给新公寓买家具。

examples.en: It’s cheaper to buy furniture during holiday sales.
examples.zh: 节假日促销时买家具更便宜。

examples.en: Before you buy furniture, measure the room first.
examples.zh: 买家具之前，先量一下房间尺寸。

definition.en: (common in shopping contexts) to choose and pay for furniture as a planned task
definition.zh: （购物语境常用）把“挑选并付款买家具”当作一项计划要做的事

examples.en: I need to buy furniture, but I don’t know what style I like.
examples.zh: 我得买家具，但我不知道自己喜欢什么风格。

examples.en: Did you buy furniture online or in a store?
examples.zh: 你是在网上买家具还是去实体店买的？

extraExplanation: 在英语里更自然的说法通常是：buy furniture（买家具，泛指一批家具，不可数）或 buy some/a piece of furniture（买几件/一件家具）。注意 furniture 通常是不可数名词：不说 *furnitures。
如果强调“去逛着挑”，也常说 shop for furniture（逛着选家具）。
etymology: 由动词 buy（买）+ 名词 furniture（家具）构成的常见动宾短语；furniture 源自法语 fournir（供给、配备），后来指“房间里的陈设/家具”。
mnemonic: 把 furniture 记成“为房间提供（furnish）东西”，所以 furniture=房间里被“配齐”的物品（家具）。
想象“buy + furniture=把家‘布置’起来”：买家具就是给家里添置布置。

summary.en: purchase large quantities at once, often for savings
summary.zh: 一次性大量购买，常为省钱

definition.en: to buy large quantities of something at one time, usually to save money or reduce how often you shop
definition.zh: 一次性购买大量（同一种）东西，通常为了省钱或减少购买次数

examples.en: We buy in bulk to save money on rice and pasta.
examples.zh: 我们会一次买很多，这样米和意面更省钱。

examples.en: Restaurants often buy in bulk from wholesale suppliers.
examples.zh: 餐馆经常从批发商那里大量进货。

examples.en: If you have space at home, it can be smart to buy in bulk.
examples.zh: 如果家里有地方储存，大量购买可能更划算。

extraExplanation: 常见场景：超市大包装（family size）、仓储式会员店（warehouse club）、批发（wholesale）。
语气中性、很口语；也可说 buy something in bulk（大量买某物）。
注意：bulk 也可指“主体/大部分”（the bulk of…），但在这个短语里是“大宗/大量”的意思。
etymology: in bulk 中的 bulk 原意是“体积、量”，后来引申为“（未分装的）散装货/大宗数量”。buy in bulk 就是“按大宗数量购买”。
mnemonic: 把 bulk 记成“膨胀的大块头”→ 量很大，所以是“大量购买”。
联想“仓库（warehouse）里一大箱一大箱”→ buy in bulk。

summary.en: accept or believe an idea; or invest and become involved
summary.zh: 接受/相信某观点；或投资入股参与

definition.en: to believe that an idea, explanation, or plan is true or good; to accept it
definition.zh: 相信（某个想法/解释/计划）；接受

examples.en: I don’t buy into the rumor—it doesn’t sound reliable.
examples.zh: 我不相信那个传闻——听起来不可靠。

examples.en: The team bought into the new strategy and worked harder.
examples.zh: 团队接受了新策略，并更努力地工作。

definition.en: to invest money in something; to buy a share or become financially involved
definition.zh: 投资；入股；出钱参与

examples.en: Several friends bought into the startup early.
examples.zh: 几个朋友很早就投资了那家初创公司。

examples.en: If you buy into the project, you’ll get a percentage of the profits.
examples.zh: 如果你投资这个项目，你会得到一定比例的利润。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：buy into an idea/story/plan/explanation（接受某个想法/说法/计划/解释）。
语气提示：在否定句里很常见，表示“我不吃这一套/我不信”。例如：I don’t buy into that.（我不认同/我不信这一套。）
etymology: 源自 buy（购买）+ into（进入/参与）。先有“买入/投资加入”的字面含义，后来引申为“像买一样接受某种观点或说法”。
mnemonic: 把它想成“把钱或信任‘买’进去”：不仅投钱，也把‘认同’投入进去。
对应中文记忆：buy=买；into=进去 → “买进去”→“入股/参与”→“接受/认同”。

summary.en: accept an idea or invest in something
summary.zh: 认同某种说法；或出资入股/投资

definition.en: to accept or believe an idea, explanation, or plan (often too easily)
definition.zh: 接受或相信某个观点、解释或计划（常含“轻易相信/被说服”的意思）

examples.en: I don’t buy into the idea that success is only about money.
examples.zh: 我不认同“成功只等于钱”这种说法。

examples.en: She bought into his excuse, even though it didn’t sound true.
examples.zh: 尽管听起来不太真实，她还是相信了他的借口。

examples.en: The team bought into the new strategy and worked hard to make it succeed.
examples.zh: 团队认同新策略，并努力让它成功。

definition.en: to invest money in something (a business, project, or plan), usually by purchasing a share or becoming involved financially
definition.zh: 出资参与；投资于（某个项目/公司/计划），通常指买份额或在资金上参与

examples.en: Several investors bought into the startup during its first year.
examples.zh: 这家创业公司成立第一年就有好几位投资人入股。

examples.en: If you buy into the fund, your money will be managed by professionals.
examples.zh: 如果你投资这个基金，你的钱会由专业人士管理。

extraExplanation: 语气与搭配：buy into sth 常用于表示“对某种观点/宣传/借口买账或不买账”。否定更常见：don’t buy into… / didn’t buy into…
近义表达对比：believe in 更偏“信仰/信任（某人或某种价值）”；buy into 更像“被说服、接受某个说法或计划”，常带一点怀疑或批判的语气。
etymology: “buy into”原意与“买入/入股”有关；后来在口语中引申为“买账、认同（某种说法）”，好像你用“相信/支持”来“付钱买单”。
mnemonic: 想成“买账”：对某个说法愿意“买单”，就等于认同、接受。
也可联想“入股”：buy into = 买入并加入（观点上加入/资金上加入）。

summary.en: Buy with the expectation of a price increase; take a long position.
summary.zh: 买入以押注价格上涨；做多。

definition.en: To purchase an asset in order to profit if its price rises; to take a long position (common in finance).
definition.zh: （金融）买入某项资产以在价格上涨时获利；做多（建立多头仓位）。

examples.en: Some investors buy long when they expect the stock to rise over the next few months.
examples.zh: 一些投资者在预计股价未来几个月会上涨时会选择买入做多。

examples.en: He decided to buy long on oil after reading the supply report.
examples.zh: 看完供给报告后，他决定买入原油做多。

definition.en: To buy something with the intention of keeping it for a long time (less fixed; more general usage).
definition.zh: （更通用）购买某物并打算长期持有/使用。

examples.en: If you plan to buy long, choose a durable laptop with good support.
examples.zh: 如果你打算长期使用，最好选一台耐用且售后好的笔记本电脑。

examples.en: They buy long and avoid changing cars too often.
examples.zh: 他们买车会考虑长期使用，尽量不频繁换车。

extraExplanation: 在美式金融英语里更常见的说法是 go long（做多）、take a long position（建立多头仓位）、be long (on) something（持有……的多头）。buy long 能听懂，但在正式写作中不如上述表达常用。
etymology: 源自交易术语：buy（买入）+ long（多头/看涨方向）。在市场语境中，long 表示“押注上涨”的一方，与 short（做空）相对。
mnemonic: 把 long 记成“长线/长期 + 看涨”：buy long = 买入并期待价格往上走。
联想“长（long）= 往上拉长曲线”：做多希望价格曲线变“更长、更高”。

summary.en: purchase lottery tickets; sometimes used to mean taking a long-shot risk for a big possible reward
summary.zh: 购买彩票；也可比喻为搏一个小概率但可能高回报的机会

definition.en: to purchase tickets for a lottery (a game where a small chance can win a prize)
definition.zh: 买彩票；购买彩票（用来参加抽奖/博彩）

examples.en: She buys lottery tickets every Friday after work.
examples.zh: 她每周五下班后都会买彩票。

examples.en: I bought two lottery tickets at the convenience store.
examples.zh: 我在便利店买了两张彩票。

examples.en: He doesn’t usually gamble, but he’ll buy lottery tickets for fun sometimes.
examples.zh: 他一般不赌博，但有时会为了好玩买买彩票。

definition.en: (informal, figurative) to take a long shot—do something with a very small chance of success but a possible big payoff
definition.zh: （非正式，比喻）赌一把；搏一搏（成功概率很小，但可能回报很大）

examples.en: Applying to that top school is kind of buying lottery tickets, but you might get in.
examples.zh: 申请那所顶尖学校有点像买彩票，但你可能会被录取。

examples.en: It felt like buying lottery tickets—unlikely, but the reward could be huge.
examples.zh: 这感觉就像买彩票——希望不大，但回报可能很大。

extraExplanation: 在英语里更自然的说法通常是：buy a lottery ticket / buy lottery tickets。说“purchase lottery tickets”更正式。
注意与“win the lottery（中彩票）”“hit the jackpot（中头奖）”等搭配使用。
etymology: 源自“lottery（抽奖/彩票）+ ticket（票）”的字面组合；因彩票“概率很低但可能中大奖”，在口语中引申出“搏一把/赌小概率大回报”的比喻用法。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：buy（买）+ lottery（抽奖）+ tickets（票）= 买“抽奖票”。
联想中文“买彩票=买个希望”，对应英语里引申义“take a long shot”。

summary.en: to purchase more than necessary
summary.zh: 购买超过所需的量

definition.en: to purchase a larger amount than is necessary; to buy extra, often “just in case”
definition.zh: 买超过所需的量；多买一些（常指“以防万一”）

examples.en: People sometimes buy more than they need when a storm is coming.
examples.zh: 暴风雨要来时，人们有时会买超过所需的量。

examples.en: Try to plan your meals so you don’t buy more than you need and waste food.
examples.zh: 尽量规划好餐食，这样就不会买超过所需的量并浪费食物。

examples.en: He bought more than he needed because the items were on sale.
examples.zh: 因为打折，他买得比需要的更多。

extraExplanation: 在新闻或社会话题里，这种行为有时与“panic buying（恐慌性抢购）”相关：人们担心短缺或涨价，于是大量囤货。
“they”在这里可以泛指“人们/一些人”，不一定指某个特定群体；也可以换成“you / we”。
etymology: 这是由常见动词短语“buy + more than + 需要量（they need / you need）”组成的字面表达，用来强调“购买量超过实际需求”。日常口语中也常用更简短的说法如“overbuy”。
mnemonic: 把结构记成公式：buy + more than + need（need=需要）。看到“more than”就想到“超过”。
联想中文“买多了/多囤点”，对应英语的“buy more than they need / stock up”。

summary.en: to use money to make someone cooperate or to settle/stop trouble; sometimes to buy up a whole supply
summary.zh: 用钱让人配合或把麻烦/纠纷摆平；有时指把某物全部买下

definition.en: to pay someone (often secretly) to make them do what you want, especially to stop them from causing trouble or to get unfair help; to bribe
definition.zh: （常指私下）用钱收买某人，让其按你的意思做事；贿赂

examples.en: The company tried to buy off the inspector to avoid a fine.
examples.zh: 那家公司试图收买检查员以避免罚款。

examples.en: He refused to be bought off, even when they offered him a lot of money.
examples.zh: 即使他们给了他很多钱，他也拒绝被收买。

definition.en: to pay someone money to settle a complaint or to make them stop asking for more; to pay off
definition.zh: 用钱了结纠纷/封口；花钱让对方不再追究

examples.en: They bought off the victim’s family with a large settlement.
examples.zh: 他们用一大笔和解金摆平了受害者家属。

examples.en: She tried to buy him off so he would drop the lawsuit.
examples.zh: 她想用钱让他撤诉。

definition.en: to buy all of a supply of something (so others cannot get it)
definition.zh: 把（某物的）存货全部买下（使别人买不到）

examples.en: Collectors quickly bought off the entire stock of the limited edition.
examples.zh: 收藏者很快把限量版的库存全部买走了。

extraExplanation: 常见用法：buy off sb.（收买某人）；be bought off（被收买）。
语感提醒：含“用钱摆平”的负面色彩很强，尤其是指贿赂或不正当交易时。表示合法和解时，也可能用在语境较中性的“赔偿/和解”，但仍带一点“封口、息事宁人”的感觉。
etymology: “buy”表示“购买”，“off”有“让其停止/脱离”的含义；合起来引申为“花钱让某人停止反对或改变立场”，进一步固定为“收买/贿赂”之意。
mnemonic: 联想：用钱把麻烦“买走（buy…off）”，让对方“离开/停止（off）”。
记法：off=“停止/甩开”，buy off=“花钱甩开问题/对手”。

summary.en: to use money or benefits to make someone stop opposing you or to drop a complaint
summary.zh: 用钱或好处让某人停止反对或放弃投诉/索赔

definition.en: to bribe someone to make them do what you want (often to stop them from causing trouble or to keep them quiet)
definition.zh: （用钱或好处）收买某人；贿赂某人（常为让对方别找麻烦或保持沉默）

examples.en: The company tried to buy off the inspector to ignore the violations.
examples.zh: 公司试图收买检查员，让他无视这些违规行为。

examples.en: He refused to be bought off by their offer.
examples.zh: 他拒绝被他们的条件收买。

examples.en: They attempted to buy off the witness so she wouldn’t testify.
examples.zh: 他们试图收买证人，让她不要出庭作证。

definition.en: to pay someone a sum of money so they will give up a claim, complaint, or legal action
definition.zh: （付钱）让某人放弃索赔/投诉/诉讼；花钱摆平

examples.en: They bought him off with a settlement to avoid a lawsuit.
examples.zh: 他们用和解金把他摆平，以避免打官司。

examples.en: The landlord tried to buy off the tenant to move out early.
examples.zh: 房东想付钱让房客提前搬走。

extraExplanation: 语气与场景：多用于负面语境（贿赂、封口费、暗中交易）。如果是合法和解，常见更中性的说法是 “reach a settlement / compensate someone”。
语法提示：sb. 必须是人（buy off somebody）。常见被动：be bought off（被收买）。
etymology: 源自“buy（买）+ off（让……离开/停止）”的组合用法；引申为“用钱让对方停止反对或放弃权利”，后来常带有“贿赂、收买”的负面含义。
mnemonic: 把 off 理解成“走开/别闹了”：用钱让某人“off（退场）”，所以是“收买/摆平”。
联想“封口费”：用钱让对方“闭嘴并离开麻烦”。

summary.en: purchase now and pay later under a credit arrangement
summary.zh: 先买后付；赊购

definition.en: to purchase something now and pay for it later, usually with a promise to pay or through a credit account/card
definition.zh: 赊购；先买后付（通常通过信用账户/信用卡，之后再付款）

examples.en: You can buy on credit, but you’ll pay interest if you don’t pay the balance in full.
examples.zh: 你可以赊购，但如果不全额还清余额，就要付利息。

examples.en: The store refused to let him buy on credit because he had missed payments before.
examples.zh: 这家店拒绝让他赊购，因为他以前有过逾期付款。

examples.en: Many small businesses buy supplies on credit to manage cash flow.
examples.zh: 很多小企业会赊购原材料来管理现金流。

extraExplanation: “buy on credit”常用于日常消费（用信用卡）或商业交易（赊账、挂账）。
与“buy on installment(s)”不同：installments强调“分期付款（按期分几次付）”；credit强调“先欠着，之后再还（可以一次还清，也可能分期）”。
相关说法：on credit（赊账）、extend credit（给予赊账额度）、credit terms（赊账条款，如Net 30）。
etymology: “credit”来自拉丁语 credere（相信、信任），核心含义是“基于信任先给你东西/钱，之后再还”。“buy on credit”字面就是“在信用/赊账条件下购买”。
mnemonic: 把credit记成“可-得-（kě dé）”：因为商家“相信你”，你就“可得”先拿到商品，之后再付钱。
联想中文“赊账”：先把账“赊着”，对应英文“on credit”。

summary.en: purchase complete ownership or the entire available supply
summary.zh: 收购/买断以获得完全所有权；或把现有供应全部买光

definition.en: to buy all of a company, a business, or someone’s share so you gain full control or ownership
definition.zh: 买下（公司/业务/股份）从而获得全部控制权或所有权

examples.en: A larger company tried to buy out the smaller competitor.
examples.zh: 一家更大的公司试图收购那家较小的竞争对手。

examples.en: She bought out her business partner and became the only owner.
examples.zh: 她买下了合伙人的股份，成了唯一的老板。

examples.en: The founders refused the offer to buy them out.
examples.zh: 创始人拒绝了把他们“买断/收购”的报价。

definition.en: to buy all the available supply of something
definition.zh: 把（某物的）现有供应全部买走；包圆

examples.en: Fans bought out all the tickets within minutes.
examples.zh: 粉丝几分钟内就把票全部抢光了。

examples.en: The store’s masks were bought out after the news report.
examples.zh: 新闻报道后，店里的口罩被一抢而空。

extraExplanation: 常见商业名词：buyout（n. 收购；买断）。例如：a management buyout（管理层收购）。
语感提示：buy out sb. 常指“买下某人的股份/让某人退出”；buy out a store’s stock 常指“把某家店的货买光”。
etymology: 由“buy（买）+ out（出去/全部）”构成，含义是“把某人/某物的份额买到‘外面去’”，引申为“买断、收购”或“把库存买光”。
mnemonic: 把 out 理解成“全部都出去了（被买走了）”，所以 buy out = “买到空/买断”。
联想“买断（买到对方退出）”：你买了对方的份额，对方就“out（出局）”。

summary.en: to gain full ownership or end an agreement by paying money
summary.zh: 通过付钱获得完全所有权，或让对方退出/提前解除协议

definition.en: to buy a company or business completely (often by purchasing all or most of its shares)
definition.zh: （通过购买全部或大部分股份）完全收购一家公司/企业

examples.en: The larger firm bought out its smaller competitor last year.
examples.zh: 那家更大的公司去年收购了它较小的竞争对手。

examples.en: A private equity group offered to buy out the company at a higher price.
examples.zh: 一家私募股权集团提出以更高价格对该公司进行收购。

definition.en: to buy someone’s share in a business or property so you become the sole owner (or have a larger share)
definition.zh: 买下他人在企业/房产中的份额（使自己成为唯一或更大份额的所有者）

examples.en: She bought out her partner and ran the store alone.
examples.zh: 她买下了合伙人的份额，独自经营那家店。

examples.en: After the divorce, he bought her out of the house.
examples.zh: 离婚后，他买下了她在房子里的那部分产权。

definition.en: to pay money to end an agreement early (such as a contract, lease, or membership)
definition.zh: 支付费用以提前解除协议（如合同、租约或会员）

examples.en: There’s a fee if you want to buy out the lease early.
examples.zh: 如果你想提前解除租约，需要支付一笔费用。

examples.en: The team bought out his contract so he could join another club.
examples.zh: 球队买断了他的合同，好让他加入另一家俱乐部。

definition.en: to purchase all of the available supply of something
definition.zh: 把现有供货全部买光

examples.en: Fans bought out the concert tickets in minutes.
examples.zh: 粉丝几分钟内就把演唱会门票买光了。

examples.en: The shop was bought out of masks during the storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨期间，那家店的口罩被买光了。

extraExplanation: 名词形式是 buyout，常见于商业新闻：a buyout（一次收购/买断）。
常见搭配：buy out a company（收购公司）、buy someone out（买下某人的份额/让某人退出）、buy out a contract/lease（买断合同/租约）。
相关术语：management buyout（管理层收购，常写作 MBO）。
etymology: 来自“buy（买）+ out（全部/退出）”，核心意思是“用钱买到完全拥有/让对方退出/把东西买光”。商业语境中逐渐固定为“（股权）收购、买断”。
mnemonic: 把 out 理解成“让对方退出/外面去”：用钱把别人“买出去”＝买断、买下份额。
联想“买到外面都没有了”：把库存都买到“外面空了”＝买光。

summary.en: purchase someone’s ownership or rights completely, often to gain control or end an agreement
summary.zh: 把某人的股份/权益或权利买断，常用于取得控制权或提前解除约定

definition.en: to purchase all (or a controlling share of) a company, business, or someone’s ownership so that you take full or main control
definition.zh: 买下（公司/业务的全部或控股股份）；收购；把某人的股份/权益买断，从而取得全部或主要控制权

examples.en: A larger firm bought out the startup and kept the brand name.
examples.zh: 一家更大的公司收购了这家初创公司，并保留了品牌名称。

examples.en: She was bought out by her partners and left the business.
examples.zh: 她的合伙人把她的股份买断了，她离开了公司。

examples.en: The company offered to buy out shareholders at a premium.
examples.zh: 公司提出以溢价回购（买断）股东的股份。

definition.en: to pay someone a sum of money to end a contract, claim, or obligation (so they give up their rights)
definition.zh: 用一笔钱让某人放弃合同/索赔/义务（买断其权利）；用钱提前解除约定

examples.en: The team tried to buy out his contract so he could leave early.
examples.zh: 球队试图买断他的合同，让他可以提前离开。

examples.en: They bought out the tenant to end the lease before renovations.
examples.zh: 为了装修，他们付钱让房客提前解除租约（买断）。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：buy out a company（收购公司）、buy out a partner/shareholder（买断合伙人/股东）、buy out a contract（买断合同）。
区分：buy up 更偏“把市场上的东西大量买光”；buy out 更偏“买断权益/控制权”，常见于商业与合同语境。
etymology: 源自短语动词 buy out（buy“购买”+ out“彻底地/全部地”），强调“把对方的份额、权益或约束全部买走”，从而“完全解决/取得控制”。
mnemonic: 记成“买到对方 out（出局）”：把对方的股份/权利买走，对方就“出局/退出”。
联想“out=全部清空”：buy out=把对方在里面的份额买到清零。

summary.en: bribe someone to stop opposing you or to keep quiet
summary.zh: 贿赂/收买某人，使其不再反对或保持沉默

definition.en: to bribe someone so they stop causing trouble, stop opposing you, or keep quiet (often about something wrong or illegal)
definition.zh: （用钱等）收买某人/贿赂某人，使其不再找麻烦、不再反对或保持沉默（常与不正当或违法之事有关）

examples.en: The company tried to buy the journalist off to stop the story.
examples.zh: 那家公司试图收买那位记者，让他别报道那条新闻。

examples.en: He refused to be bought off and reported the corruption.
examples.zh: 他拒绝被收买，并举报了腐败行为。

examples.en: They bought off the witness to change his statement.
examples.zh: 他们收买了证人，让他改口。

extraExplanation: 语气与用法：这是强烈的负面表达，常暗示不道德或违法（bribery）。正式写作或新闻语境中常见。
结构提示：buy somebody off（off后不加宾语）；可用被动：be bought off（被收买）。
近义区分：bribe更中性地表示“行贿”；buy sb. off更强调“让对方停止对抗/麻烦或闭嘴”的目的。
etymology: 源自“buy（买）+ off（使停止/打消）”的组合：用钱“买走”对方的反对或麻烦。该用法在英语中长期与贿赂、封口等含义相关。
mnemonic: 把off理解为“让……停掉”：用钱把对方的反对/麻烦“关掉”。
联想中文“花钱摆平/封口费”：用钱解决对方的阻碍。

summary.en: pay to remove someone’s share or involvement; sometimes pay to silence or stop them
summary.zh: 花钱让某人退出股份/协议或不再参与；有时指收买封口

definition.en: to pay someone a large amount of money to get their share of a business, property, or agreement, so they no longer have any control or involvement
definition.zh: 花一大笔钱买下某人的股份/权益，使其退出并不再参与或拥有控制权

examples.en: The company offered to buy him out after disagreements about strategy.
examples.zh: 在战略分歧之后，公司提出把他的股份买下来让他退出。

examples.en: She bought her partner out and became the sole owner of the shop.
examples.zh: 她买下合伙人的股份，成了店铺的唯一老板。

examples.en: They tried to buy the landlord out of the lease agreement.
examples.zh: 他们试图花钱让房东退出这份租约协议。

definition.en: to pay someone money to stop them from doing something or to keep them quiet (often suggesting something unethical or illegal)
definition.zh: 花钱收买某人让其停止做某事或保持沉默（常含不道德或违法的暗示）

examples.en: The witness said someone tried to buy him out to change his statement.
examples.zh: 证人说有人想收买他，让他改口。

examples.en: They denied any attempt to buy officials out.
examples.zh: 他们否认曾试图收买官员。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：buy sb out of sth（把某人从某事/协议中“买出去”），如 buy him out of the contract（花钱让他退出合同）。
商业写法里也常见名词形式 buyout（n. 收购；买断），如 management buyout（管理层收购）。
语气注意：用于“收买、封口”的含义时，语境往往带有负面评价，接近 bribe。
etymology: 由短语动词 buy out 构成：buy（购买）+ out（把对方“买出去/买到退出”）。最常见于商业语境，指用钱让某人退出所有权或协议。
mnemonic: 把 out 理解成“出局/退出”：buy sb out = 用钱让某人 out（退出）。
联想“买断”：中文里“买断某人的股份/合同”，就是 buy sb out（of sth）。

summary.en: purchase something for another person
summary.zh: 为别人购买东西

definition.en: to purchase something for someone
definition.zh: 给某人买某物；为某人购买某物

examples.en: I’ll buy you a coffee.
examples.zh: 我给你买杯咖啡。

examples.en: She bought her brother a birthday gift.
examples.zh: 她给弟弟买了生日礼物。

examples.en: Can you buy me some medicine on your way home?
examples.zh: 你回家路上能帮我买点药吗？

extraExplanation: 结构：buy + sb. + sth.（sb.=somebody 某人；sth.=something 某物）。更正式/更常见的同义结构是：buy + sth. + for + sb.（I’ll buy a coffee for you）。
注意：sb. 和 sth. 都是缩写，写作作业或正式场合通常要写全：buy someone something。
常见搭配：buy me a drink / buy her lunch / buy them tickets。
etymology: buy 来自古英语，原义与“交换、获得”有关；这种“双宾语结构”（buy + 人 + 物）在英语中长期存在，用来强调“受益者（谁得到）”。
mnemonic: 记成“买（buy）→ 先想到人（sb.）→ 再想到东西（sth.）”：给谁买什么。
和中文语序很像：“给你买咖啡”≈ buy you a coffee。

summary.en: purchase a few presents
summary.zh: 购买一些礼物

definition.en: to purchase a few presents for other people
definition.zh: 买一些礼物（给别人）

examples.en: I’m going to buy some gifts for my family this weekend.
examples.zh: 我这周末要给家人买一些礼物。

examples.en: She bought some gifts to say thank you.
examples.zh: 她买了一些礼物来表示感谢。

examples.en: Let’s buy some gifts before we go to the party.
examples.zh: 我们去聚会前先买一些礼物吧。

extraExplanation: some 通常表示“数量不多但不确定/不强调具体数字”，比 a few 更口语、更模糊；如果想更明确，可以说 buy a few gifts（买几个礼物）或 buy gifts（买礼物，泛指）。
gift 在美式英语里常指“送人的礼物”，与 present 很接近；在正式或书面语中 present 也很常用。
etymology: 这是一个常见的动词短语：buy（购买）+ some（一些）+ gifts（礼物/赠礼）。buy 来自古英语，gifts 与“给予”相关的词源有关。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：buy=买，some=一些，gifts=礼物；连起来就是“买一些礼物”。
联想场景：逛商场/网购前对自己说一句：I need to buy some gifts（我得买点礼物）。

summary.en: purchase mementos from a trip or place
summary.zh: 购买旅行或某地的纪念品

definition.en: to purchase small items that remind you of a place, trip, or experience (often while traveling)
definition.zh: 购买纪念品；买一些能让人想起某个地方、旅行或经历的小物件（多用于旅行时）

examples.en: We stopped at the market to buy souvenirs for our friends.
examples.zh: 我们在市场停下来给朋友买纪念品。

examples.en: Don’t forget to buy souvenirs before you leave the city.
examples.zh: 离开这座城市前别忘了买纪念品。

examples.en: She likes to buy souvenirs such as postcards and keychains when she travels.
examples.zh: 她旅行时喜欢买明信片、钥匙扣之类的纪念品。

extraExplanation: 口语里也常说“pick up souvenirs”（顺便买点纪念品）或“get souvenirs”。
常见纪念品：postcards（明信片）、magnets（冰箱贴）、keychains（钥匙扣）、local crafts（当地手工艺品）。
etymology: “souvenir”来自法语 souvenir（意为“记忆、回忆；纪念物”），在英语里常指旅行时买来留作纪念的小物件；搭配 buy（购买）就形成常用短语。
mnemonic: souvenir 听起来像“so-venir（把回忆带回来）”，买纪念品=把旅行记忆带回家。
联想：旅行结束前在景点商店“buy souvenirs”，给家人朋友带小礼物。

summary.en: purchase something for another person
summary.zh: 给别人买东西

definition.en: to purchase something intended for another person; to pay so someone can have it
definition.zh: 给某人买某物；为某人购买（并付钱）

examples.en: I’ll buy a coffee for you.
examples.zh: 我给你买杯咖啡。

examples.en: She bought a birthday gift for her brother.
examples.zh: 她给弟弟买了生日礼物。

examples.en: Could you buy some medicine for your dad?
examples.zh: 你能给你爸爸买点药吗？

extraExplanation:
常见两种表达：buy something for someone 和 buy someone something。意思相同：
- I bought a gift for her. = I bought her a gift.
但当“某物”很长或很复杂时，更常用 buy something for someone。
易错点：for 表示“给/为了（受益者）”，不是 buy something to someone（英语里一般不这么说）。
和 pay for 区分：pay for sth 强调“付款”，buy sth 强调“买到/购买”。例如：I paid for the tickets（我付了票钱），I bought the tickets（我买了票）。
etymology: 源自基础动词 buy（来自古英语 byrgan，意为“购买”）+ 介词 for（表示“为了/给”）。结构 buy + something + for + someone 强调“购买的对象是某物”，受益者是“某人”。
mnemonic: 把 for 记成“为了/给”：buy A for B = “为了B去买A” → 给B买A。
中文顺口记：buy...for... = “买…给…”（for = 给）。

summary.en: purchase something from a specific source
summary.zh: 从特定来源购买某物

definition.en: to purchase something from a particular person, store, website, or company
definition.zh: 从某个人/商店/网站/公司购买某物

examples.en: I usually buy vegetables from the local market.
examples.zh: 我通常从本地市场买蔬菜。

examples.en: She bought a laptop from an online shop.
examples.zh: 她从一家网店买了一台笔记本电脑。

examples.en: We buy our coffee from the café across the street.
examples.zh: 我们从街对面的咖啡馆买咖啡。

definition.en: to get something from a source by paying money (can also be used in business contexts, e.g., buying supplies from a supplier)
definition.zh: 付钱从某个来源获取（也常用于商业语境，如从供应商采购）

examples.en: The restaurant buys fresh seafood from a trusted supplier.
examples.zh: 这家餐厅从可靠的供应商那里采购新鲜海鲜。

examples.en: They buy parts from factories in different countries.
examples.zh: 他们从不同国家的工厂购买零件。

extraExplanation: 结构：buy + 物品 + from + 来源（人/店/网站/公司）。
与“buy … at …”区别：from 强调“从哪里/谁那里买”，at 更强调“在某个地点买”（有时两者都对，但侧重点不同）。例：I bought it from Walmart. / I bought it at Walmart.
如果强调“向某人买”，也可用 buy … from someone；口语里也常说 buy … off someone（更像“从某人手里买下”，语气更随意）。
etymology: “buy”来自古英语“bycgan”（购买），后面常接“from”表示购买来源；“sth.”是“something”的缩写，常见于词典/笔记。
mnemonic: 记忆：from=“从”。buy sth. from… 就是“从……买……”。
把句子拆开：buy（买）+ something（某物）+ from（从）+ source（来源）。

summary.en: buy something in physical stores rather than online
summary.zh: 在实体店购买（相对网购）

definition.en: to buy something in physical stores (not online), usually by going to one or more shops
definition.zh: 在实体店里买某物（通常指去商店购买，而不是网购）

examples.en: I prefer to buy clothes in the shops so I can try them on.
examples.zh: 我更喜欢在实体店买衣服，因为我可以试穿。

examples.en: You can buy it in the shops downtown, but it’s sold out online.
examples.zh: 你可以在市中心的实体店买到，但网上已经卖完了。

examples.en: She went out to buy some snacks in the shops near her home.
examples.zh: 她出门去家附近的商店买些零食。

extraExplanation: “in the shops”在英式英语里很常见，意思是“在实体店里（可以买到/购买）”。美式英语更常说“in stores”。
如果你想表达“去逛街买东西”的过程，更自然的说法是“shop for sth.”；而“buy sth. in the shops/in stores”更强调购买地点是实体店。
etymology: “shop”来自古英语/日耳曼语系词，原意与“工作间、摊位”相关；“in the shops”是常见搭配，尤在英式英语中用来泛指“在实体店里（可以买到/购买）”。
mnemonic: 把“shops”想成“商铺/门店”，所以“in the shops”=“在店里”。
联想：网购是“online”，相对的实体店就是“in stores / in the shops”。

summary.en: purchase now and pay later
summary.zh: 先买后付；赊账购买

definition.en: to purchase something now and pay for it later, usually based on an agreement or trust that you will repay
definition.zh: 赊账购买；先买后付（基于对你会付款的信任或协议）

examples.en: He bought a new phone on credit and will pay it off over six months.
examples.zh: 他赊买了一部新手机，将在六个月内分期还清。

examples.en: Many small shops won’t let customers buy on credit anymore.
examples.zh: 很多小店现在不再允许顾客赊账了。

examples.en: She bought groceries on credit when money was tight.
examples.zh: 她手头紧的时候赊账买了些日用品。

extraExplanation: 常见用法：buy something on credit（赊买某物）；purchase on credit 更正式。
on credit 不等于 by credit card：用信用卡支付通常是立刻完成交易；但从个人角度也属于“先消费后还款”。口语中两者有时会被混用，但严格说 on credit 更强调“赊账/分期/记账”。
搭配：pay on credit（赊购付款方式）；pay off (a debt)（还清欠款）；buy on installment(s)（分期购买）。
etymology: “credit”源自拉丁语 credere（相信、信任）。因此 on credit 的核心含义就是“基于信任，先拿货后付款”。
mnemonic: 把 credit 记成“信贷/信用”：on credit = “在信用上”= 先用你的信用把东西拿走，之后再付钱。
联想中文“赊账”：看到 on + credit（信用）就想到“凭信用赊”。

summary.en: buy suddenly without planning
summary.zh: 未计划的一时冲动购买

definition.en: to buy something suddenly without planning, because you feel a strong immediate desire
definition.zh: 一时冲动买某样东西；临时起意购买（没计划）

examples.en: I saw the jacket on sale and bought it on impulse.
examples.zh: 我看到那件夹克在打折，就一冲动买了。

examples.en: Try not to buy snacks on impulse when you’re hungry.
examples.zh: 你饿的时候尽量别冲动买零食。

examples.en: She regretted buying the expensive phone on impulse.
examples.zh: 她后悔一时冲动买了那部昂贵的手机。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：buy/spend/decide/act on impulse（冲动购买/花钱/决定/行动）。
语气多带一点提醒或反思：冲动消费往往会“regret（后悔）”。
近义表达：impulse buy（冲动购物）是名词+动词的表达，如：I impulse-bought a bag.（较口语）
etymology: “impulse”来自拉丁语 impulse，意为“推动、冲击”。引申为“内心一股突然的冲动”，所以“on impulse”就是“在冲动之下（做某事）”。
mnemonic: 把 impulse 想成“im-pulse = 一阵脉冲”，像心里突然“嘭”一下，就买了。
联想中文“冲动消费”：冲动=impulse，消费/购买=buy。

summary.en: buy without seeing or inspecting first
summary.zh: 没见到或没检查就购买

definition.en: To buy something without seeing it first (or without checking its condition), trusting the description or seller.
definition.zh: 在没亲眼看到（或没检查状况）的情况下就购买某物；凭描述或信任卖家下单。

examples.en: I wouldn’t buy a used car sight unseen unless I could return it.
examples.zh: 除非能退货，否则我不会在没看车的情况下买二手车。

examples.en: She bought the apartment sight unseen because she was moving from another country.
examples.zh: 因为要从国外搬来，她没看房就把公寓买下了。

examples.en: Buying online often means purchasing things sight unseen.
examples.zh: 网购常常意味着在没亲眼看过的情况下买东西。

synonyms: buy a pig in a poke
extraExplanation: 常见搭配：buy/purchase + 名词 + sight unseen（如 buy it sight unseen）。
语气与场景：多用于口语或写作中提醒风险，常暗示“有点冒险/不太稳妥”。
相关表达：buy a pig in a poke（买到货不对板/盲买有风险，较老的习语）。
etymology: 短语由“sight（视线、看到）+ unseen（未看见的）”构成，字面意思是“没看见就买”。常用于强调购买时缺少实物检查这一风险。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：sight（看到）+ unseen（没看到）→ “没看到就买”。
联想网购：图片看得到但实物没见过＝sight unseen。

summary.en: buy something as takeout
summary.zh: 买外带（打包带走）

definition.en: to purchase food or drink to take away and eat or drink elsewhere (not in the restaurant or café)
definition.zh: 买外带的食物或饮料（不在店里吃/喝，而是带走）

examples.en: I'd like to buy a coffee to go, please.
examples.zh: 我想买一杯咖啡外带，谢谢。

examples.en: We bought sandwiches to go and ate them in the park.
examples.zh: 我们买了三明治外带，在公园里吃。

extraExplanation: 在美国点餐时常见搭配："For here or to go?"（堂食还是外带？）。
也常说："Can I get this to go?" 或 "A latte to go."；英式英语更常用 “takeaway/take away”。
etymology: 源自美式英语餐饮用语 “to go”，意思是“带走/外带”；与 “for here”（堂食）相对。
mnemonic: 把 “to go” 记成“要走了”，所以食物也“跟着走”＝外带。

summary.en: to purchase all available items of something
summary.zh: 把某物全部买光；抢购或收购

definition.en: to buy all of something that is available (often quickly), so that none is left for others
definition.zh: 把某物（可买到的）全部买光；抢购（通常很快地）

examples.en: Fans bought up all the concert tickets in minutes.
examples.zh: 粉丝几分钟就把演唱会门票全都抢购一空。

examples.en: During the sale, shoppers bought up the last of the winter coats.
examples.zh: 打折期间，顾客把最后一批冬季外套都买光了。

examples.en: Large companies sometimes buy up smaller firms to grow faster.
examples.zh: 大公司有时会收购小公司来更快扩张。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：buy up tickets / shares / supplies / land。
语气提示：有时带一点负面意味，暗示“囤货/垄断式购买”，尤其在物资紧张时。
etymology: “buy up”里“up”有“彻底、完全”的语气（类似“eat up”吃光、“use up”用完），所以“buy up”强调“把能买到的都买走”。
mnemonic: 把“up”理解成“到头/到尽头”：买到“没得买”为止＝买光。
联想“eat up（吃光）→ buy up（买光）”，同一个“up=彻底”。

summary.en: purchase specific clothing items; shop for clothing
summary.zh: 购买特定衣物；买衣服（泛指）

definition.en: to purchase specific clothing items (the ones already identified or previously mentioned)
definition.zh: 购买特定的那几件/那批衣服（双方已知道或前文提到的）

examples.en: I’ll buy the clothes you picked out yesterday.
examples.zh: 我会买你昨天挑好的那几件衣服。

examples.en: If you like them, just buy the clothes and we’ll leave.
examples.zh: 如果你喜欢，就把那几件衣服买了，我们就走。

definition.en: to shop for clothing in general (often said as “buy clothes” without “the”)
definition.zh: 买衣服（泛指购买衣物，一般不用 the）

examples.en: We need to buy clothes for the trip.
examples.zh: 我们得为这次旅行买些衣服。

examples.en: She likes to buy clothes online.
examples.zh: 她喜欢在网上买衣服。

extraExplanation: “clothes”在英语里通常当作复数名词使用：clothes are…。单说一件用“a piece/item of clothing”或具体名称（a shirt, a coat）。
“buy the clothes”里的“the”表示“特指”：指某一套/某一批已经明确的衣服（你指着的、之前谈过的、或某人挑好的）。如果只是泛指“买衣服”，更自然说“buy clothes”。
口语里也常说“get some clothes”（去买/弄到一些衣服），语气更随意。
etymology: “buy”源自古英语 bycgan，意为“购买、取得”；“clothes”来自古英语 clāþ（布、衣物）。短语“buy (the) clothes”就是动词+宾语的常见结构。
mnemonic: 记法：buy ≈ “掰一”（把钱“掰”出去买一件）→ 买。
the = “特定的那一批”：看到 the 就联想到“那几件/那套”。

summary.en: purchase goods promoted in advertisements
summary.zh: 购买广告宣传的商品

definition.en: To purchase items that have been promoted in ads (on TV, online, in print, etc.).
definition.zh: 购买广告中宣传的商品（电视、网络、纸媒等）。

examples.en: Many people buy the products advertised during the Super Bowl.
examples.zh: 很多人会购买超级碗期间广告宣传的商品。

examples.en: If you buy the products advertised by influencers, compare prices first.
examples.zh: 如果你要买网红推广的商品，先比价。

definition.en: Used as an instruction or goal in marketing, meaning “convert ads into sales.”
definition.zh: （营销语境）作为指令或目标，意思是“让广告转化为实际销量”。

examples.en: Our campaign aims to make more viewers buy the products advertised.
examples.zh: 我们的广告活动目标是让更多观众购买广告中推广的商品。

examples.en: The whole strategy is designed to get people to buy the products advertised.
examples.zh: 整个策略就是为了让人们购买广告宣传的商品。

extraExplanation: 语法提示：advertised 在这里相当于一个形容词短语，= “that are advertised”（被宣传的）。例如：the products advertised on TV = 电视上打广告的商品。
语用提示：在批判性语境中，这句话有时带一点“被广告影响、被带货”的含义；在营销语境中则更中性，表示“促成购买”。
etymology: 直译性短语：buy（购买）+ the products（这些商品）+ advertised（被广告宣传的，过去分词作后置定语修饰 products）。常见于广告学、媒体讨论与消费者行为语境。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：buy=买；products=产品；advertised≈ad（广告）+vert（转）→被广告“转”出来的产品。
联想中文：ad（广告）让你“爱得（ad）”想买 → buy the products advertised。

summary.en: be persuaded by claims of mutual benefit
summary.zh: 被“双方都有利”的说法所说服

definition.en: to accept or be persuaded by talk that claims a situation will benefit everyone involved (sometimes implying you believe the message rather than the reality)
definition.zh: 接受或被“对双方都有利”的说法说服（有时暗示你相信的是话术而非现实）

examples.en: Some voters didn’t buy the win-win rhetoric, because the details were vague.
examples.zh: 一些选民并不买“共赢”的说法，因为细节很含糊。

examples.en: It sounds positive, but don’t buy the win-win rhetoric without checking the numbers.
examples.zh: 听起来很积极，但别不看数据就相信“共赢”的话术。

examples.en: Investors are cautious—they won’t buy the win-win rhetoric unless there’s a clear plan.
examples.zh: 投资者很谨慎——除非有明确计划，否则他们不会相信这套“共赢”话术。

extraExplanation: 语气提示：在新闻评论、职场或政治语境中，这句话常带怀疑或批评意味，相当于“别被漂亮话忽悠”。
win-win 本来是中性甚至正面的，但和 rhetoric 搭配时，往往暗示“包装得很好听”。
etymology: 短语由三部分组成：buy（口语引申义“相信、接受”）+ win-win（商业/谈判语境中“双方都赢”的流行说法）+ rhetoric（源自希腊语，指“修辞/说服性语言”，常带“话术、套话”的语感）。合起来多用于评论他人的宣传口径或公关措辞。
mnemonic: buy=“买账/信了”；rhetoric=“修辞话术”。合起来：别轻易“买账”所谓“共赢话术”。
把 win-win 想成“双赢口号”，rhetoric 想成“口号式说服”，更容易记住偏质疑的语气。

summary.en: purchase tickets via the internet
summary.zh: 通过互联网购票

definition.en: to purchase admission tickets using the internet (usually via a website or app)
definition.zh: 通过互联网（网站或应用）购买入场/乘车等票券

examples.en: It’s cheaper if you buy tickets online in advance.
examples.zh: 提前在网上买票会更便宜。

examples.en: We bought tickets online and showed the QR code at the gate.
examples.zh: 我们在网上买了票，在入口出示二维码。

examples.en: If the show sells out, you may only be able to buy tickets online.
examples.zh: 如果演出售罄，你可能只能在网上买票。

extraExplanation: 常见场景包括演唱会/电影/博物馆/主题公园/火车飞机等；“online”常暗示电子票（e-ticket）或二维码/条形码入场。
常见说法：buy tickets online in advance（提前网购票）；buy tickets online for + 活动（为某活动网购票）。
与“buy tickets on the internet”意思相同，但“online”更口语、更常见。
etymology: 这是现代英语中的常用搭配：buy（购买）+ tickets（票）+ online（在线/网上）。随着电商与电子票普及而固定下来。
mnemonic: 把 online 记成“on-line（在线上）”：在“线上”把票买好。
联想中文固定说法“网上买票/在线购票”，对应就是 buy tickets online。

summary.en: purchase playthings, often for children or collecting
summary.zh: 购买玩具（多为孩子或收藏）

definition.en: to purchase toys (playthings), usually for a child or as a collectible
definition.zh: 购买玩具（儿童玩物或收藏品）

examples.en: I need to buy toys for my niece’s birthday.
examples.zh: 我得给我侄女买生日玩具。

examples.en: We bought toys online because the store was closed.
examples.zh: 因为商店关门了，我们在网上买了玩具。

examples.en: Some adults buy toys as collectibles, like action figures.
examples.zh: 有些成年人买玩具作收藏，比如手办或人偶。

definition.en: an imperative used to tell or encourage someone to purchase toys
definition.zh: 祈使用法：让/鼓励某人去买玩具

examples.en: Buy toys that are safe and age-appropriate.
examples.zh: 买安全、适合年龄的玩具。

examples.en: Don’t just buy toys—spend time playing with your child, too.
examples.zh: 别只顾着买玩具——也要花时间陪孩子一起玩。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：buy toys for someone（给某人买玩具）；buy toys online（网购玩具）；buy toys for kids（给孩子买玩具）。
语用提醒：在广告或建议中常用祈使句“Buy toys …”。在日常叙述中更常说“buy some toys / buy a toy”。
etymology: “buy”来自古英语 bycgan（购买）；“toy”在英语中逐渐发展为“玩具、玩物”的意思，现代常指儿童玩具或可收藏的玩物。
mnemonic: buy /baɪ/ 听起来像“拜”：去商店“拜一拜”，顺便就买了。
toy 像“to-y”：想到“toys”就是“给孩子玩的东西”。

summary.en: purchase all available items or acquire a lot quickly
summary.zh: 把某物买光；大量/迅速收购

definition.en: to buy all of something that is available, often quickly or in large amounts
definition.zh: （迅速或大量地）把现有的某物几乎都买光；大量收购

examples.en: People bought up all the tickets within an hour.
examples.zh: 人们在一小时内就把票都抢购一空了。

examples.en: A larger company bought up several smaller competitors.
examples.zh: 一家更大的公司收购了几家较小的竞争对手。

examples.en: She bought up every copy of the magazine at the store.
examples.zh: 她把店里那本杂志的所有存货都买走了。

extraExplanation: 常见语境：1）抢购/囤货（比如节假日前把某商品买光）；2）商业收购（公司“买下/收购”其他公司或其股份）。
语气上常暗含“买得很猛、导致别人买不到”的感觉；中性到略带负面，取决于语境。
etymology: 源自动词短语“buy + up”。“up”在很多英语短语动词里有“彻底、全部、用尽”的意思（类似“eat up”吃光、“use up”用完），所以“buy up”就是“买到没有剩下”。
mnemonic: 把“up”记成“向上堆满/收光”：买到库存“往上清零”。
联想“use up（用光）/eat up（吃光）”→ buy up = 买光。

summary.en: purchase nearly all of what is available, often in large quantities
summary.zh: 大量/迅速买下某物，几乎买光或进行收购

definition.en: to buy all (or most) of something that is available, often quickly or in large quantities
definition.zh: 把（某物）几乎全部买下/大量收购（常指买得很快或数量很大）

examples.en: Investors bought up the company’s shares after the announcement.
examples.zh: 公告发布后，投资者迅速大量买入该公司的股票。

examples.en: During the storm, people bought up bottled water at local stores.
examples.zh: 暴风雨期间，人们把本地商店的瓶装水几乎都买光了。

examples.en: A large firm bought up several small businesses in the area.
examples.zh: 一家大公司收购了该地区的几家小企业。

extraExplanation: 常见语气：buy up 往往暗示“抢购”“囤货”“扫货”或“收购整合”，有时带一点“把别人也买不到了”的含义，语境可能偏负面，但也可中性描述投资/并购。
常用搭配：buy up shares/stock（大量买入股票）、buy up land（大量买地）、buy up supplies（大量采购物资）、buy up small companies（收购小公司）。
etymology: 由动词 buy（购买）+ 副词 up（表示“完全、彻底”）构成的短语动词；up 强调“买到差不多全没了/全包了”的结果。
mnemonic: 把 up 理解成“向上加满”：一直买、买到“满格/全买完”。
联想“扫货”：中文里说“扫”，英文里用 up 表示“扫到没有了”。

summary.en: to bribe people for electoral support
summary.zh: 用利益贿赂他人以换取投票支持

definition.en: to try to influence an election or decision by giving people money, gifts, or favors in exchange for their votes
definition.zh: 用钱、礼物或好处来换取他人投票，以影响选举或决定（通常违法、不道德）

examples.en: The candidate was accused of trying to buy votes with cash payments.
examples.zh: 这位候选人被指控试图用现金支付来收买选票。

examples.en: In many countries, it is illegal to buy votes during an election.
examples.zh: 在许多国家，选举期间收买选票是违法的。

examples.en: The investigation focused on whether local officials helped buy votes by offering gifts.
examples.zh: 调查重点是地方官员是否通过送礼协助收买选票。

extraExplanation: 这是强烈负面含义的表达，常用于新闻与法律语境（如 corruption、election fraud）。
相关概念包括 vote buying（买票/收买选票）、electoral bribery（选举贿赂）。不同国家法律对“赠品、餐饮、交通补贴”等是否构成买票的界定可能不同。
etymology: 字面由 buy（购买）+ votes（选票）组成；含义从“买”这种交易行为引申为“用利益交换投票”的政治贿赂行为。
mnemonic: 把 votes 想成“选票”，buy votes 就是“把选票当商品买”，联想到“买票=买选票（违法）”。
中文直译记忆：buy=买，votes=票 → “买票”，但这里不是买车票电影票，而是“买选票”。

summary.en: purchase things children prefer
summary.zh: 买孩子偏爱/喜欢的东西

definition.en: to purchase the things that their children enjoy or prefer
definition.zh: 买他们孩子喜欢的东西

examples.en: Some parents buy what their children like, even if it’s expensive.
examples.zh: 有些父母会买孩子喜欢的东西，即使很贵。

examples.en: Instead of choosing for him, she tried to buy what her child likes.
examples.zh: 她不再替他做决定，而是尽量买孩子喜欢的东西。

definition.en: (in advice or marketing) to choose products based on children’s preferences rather than adults’ tastes
definition.zh: （用于建议/营销）按照孩子的偏好选购，而不是按大人的口味

examples.en: The ad says parents should buy what their children like for school lunches.
examples.zh: 广告说家长做午餐时应该买孩子喜欢的东西。

examples.en: If you want fewer arguments, buy what your children like within a budget.
examples.zh: 如果你想少吵架，就在预算内买孩子喜欢的东西。

synonyms: get their children what they want
extraExplanation: 语法要点：what their children like 是一个名词性从句，相当于“the things that their children like（他们孩子喜欢的东西）”。
易混点：their 是“他们的/她们的/它们的”。如果想表达“这些父母的孩子”，也可以用 their；若更具体可用 “his/her children”。
更自然的说法：很多场合会说 “buy their children what they like” 或 “buy things their children like”。前者更口语，后者更简洁。
etymology: 这是由常见动词“buy（买）+ what 引导的名词性从句（what their children like）”组成的口语表达；其中 what 表示“……的东西”。
mnemonic: 把 what 当成“什么东西”：buy + what... = “买（……）喜欢的东西”。
their ≈ “他/她/他们的”，联想中文“给他们家孩子买喜欢的”。

summary.en: to purchase unnecessary items; sometimes driven by advertising
summary.zh: 购买不必要的东西；有时受广告或欲望驱动

definition.en: to purchase things that are unnecessary (often implying wasteful or impulsive spending)
definition.zh: 买不需要的东西（常暗示浪费或冲动消费）

examples.en: People sometimes buy what they don’t need just because it’s on sale.
examples.zh: 人们有时会因为打折而买一些并不需要的东西。

examples.en: He realized he was buying what he didn’t need and decided to make a shopping list.
examples.zh: 他意识到自己总在买不需要的东西，于是决定先列购物清单。

definition.en: (in business/marketing) to sell products by creating desire so customers purchase things they didn’t originally need
definition.zh: （商业/营销）通过制造欲望来让顾客购买原本并不需要的东西

examples.en: Good advertising can make people buy what they don’t need.
examples.zh: 好的广告能让人买原本不需要的东西。

examples.en: The company’s strategy was to get customers to buy what they don’t need by promoting “must-have” features.
examples.zh: 这家公司的策略是通过宣传“必备”功能，让顾客购买其实不需要的东西。

extraExplanation: 语境提示：这里的“they”有时泛指“人们/消费者”，不一定指某个特定群体。
语气通常带批评或自我反省：强调“需要 vs. 想要（need vs. want）”。
etymology: 这是由常见动词“buy（买）”加上宾语从句“what they don’t need（他们不需要的东西）”构成的口语化表达；常出现在对“消费主义/冲动消费”或“广告营销影响”的讨论中。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：buy + what + they don’t need = “买+那些+不需要的”。
联想中文常说的“买了用不上/冲动消费”。

summary.en: “Buy-encouraging” describes something (ads, design, layout) that makes people more likely to buy.
summary.zh: “buy-encouraging”指某种广告、设计或布局等“促使人更想购买/更可能下单”。

definition.en: Encouraging people to buy something; likely to make customers want to purchase.
definition.zh: 促使人购买的；鼓励消费的；让人更想买的。

examples.en: The website uses buy-encouraging design, like limited-time offers and big “Add to Cart” buttons.
examples.zh: 这个网站用了促购式的设计，比如限时优惠和醒目的“加入购物车”按钮。

examples.en: The store’s buy-encouraging layout puts snacks and small items near the checkout.
examples.zh: 这家店的促购式布局把零食和小物品放在收银台附近。

examples.en: Be careful of buy-encouraging ads that push you to make quick decisions.
examples.zh: 要小心那些促购式广告，它们会催你快速做决定。

extraExplanation: “buy-encouraging”是比较少见的连字符形容词，常见于营销/广告语境，用来描述“会促使人下单”的设计、文案或策略。更常见的表达有“purchase-inducing / sales-driving / designed to encourage purchases”。
英语里用连字符把“动词+现在分词”组合成形容词很常见，用来临时说明特征，如“risk-taking”“time-saving”。这里的“buy-”相当于“purchase-”，强调与购买行为相关。

summary.en: Buy-in means support/commitment to an idea or, less commonly, money invested to join or take a stake in something.
summary.zh: Buy-in 常指对某个想法/计划的认同与支持；也可指加入或持有权益时的资金投入。

definition.en: agreement and support from people (especially a group) for an idea, plan, or decision; commitment to help make it succeed
definition.zh: （尤其指群体对某个想法/计划/决定的）认同与支持；愿意投入并促成其成功

examples.en: We need buy-in from the whole team before we change the schedule.
examples.zh: 在我们更改排班前，需要整个团队的认同与支持。

examples.en: The manager explained the reasons clearly to get buy-in from staff.
examples.zh: 经理清楚说明理由，以争取员工的认同。

examples.en: Without community buy-in, the project will be hard to implement.
examples.zh: 没有社区的支持，这个项目很难落实。

definition.en: a financial or personal stake in something; an investment or payment to join a group, deal, or program
definition.zh: （资金或个人层面的）投入/股份；（加入某个组织、交易或项目的）出资/入场费

examples.en: Each partner made a $5,000 buy-in to start the business.
examples.zh: 每位合伙人都投入了5000美元作为创业的启动资金。

examples.en: There’s a buy-in required to join the tournament.
examples.zh: 参加这场比赛需要缴纳报名费（买入费）。

definition.en: a purchase of shares (stock), especially as a strategic investment
definition.zh: （尤指策略性的）买入股票；购入股份

examples.en: The company made a buy-in to increase its ownership in the supplier.
examples.zh: 该公司通过买入股份来提高对供应商的持股比例。

examples.en: Analysts discussed whether the buy-in was timed well.
examples.zh: 分析师讨论这次买入时机是否合适。

extraExplanation: “buy-in”原意和“买入”有关，但在职场里最常见的是引申义：让别人“愿意买单/认同”，也就是心理与行动上的支持。常见搭配：get/secure buy-in（争取支持）、stakeholder buy-in（利益相关者支持）、team buy-in（团队支持）。
写作上通常作为不可数概念使用（need buy-in），也可作可数名词（a buy-in）。注意与动词短语“buy in”区分：They didn’t buy in (to the idea).（他们不认同这个想法。）

summary.en: “Buy-one-get-one” describes a BOGO promotion: buy one item and get another free (or discounted).
summary.zh: buy-one-get-one 指“买一送一/第二件优惠”的促销（BOGO）。

definition.en: A promotion where you buy one item and receive another item free (or sometimes at a reduced price). Often written as “BOGO.”
definition.zh: 一种促销活动：买一件商品，另一件免费（有时是半价或折扣）。常写作“BOGO”。

examples.en: These socks are buy-one-get-one free this weekend.
examples.zh: 这些袜子这周末买一送一。

examples.en: I only bought it because it was a buy-one-get-one deal.
examples.zh: 我买它只是因为有买一送一的优惠。

examples.en: Is the buy-one-get-one offer valid online or in-store only?
examples.zh: 这个买一送一活动是线上可用还是只限门店？

definition.en: A “buy one, get one” offer; a BOGO deal.
definition.zh: “买一送一”的优惠；BOGO活动。

examples.en: Let’s wait for a buy-one-get-one at the supermarket.
examples.zh: 我们等超市有买一送一再买吧。

examples.en: They’re running a buy-one-get-one on coffees today.
examples.zh: 他们今天咖啡在做买一送一活动。

extraExplanation: 常见写法有：buy one, get one（中间用逗号）；buy-one-get-one（用连字符，常作定语）；BOGO（口语/广告缩写）。实际规则可能是“第二件免费”或“第二件半价”，购物时可看小字条款（terms and conditions）。

summary.en: Buyable means “able to be bought” (available for purchase), and sometimes “able to be bribed or influenced by money.”
summary.zh: buyable 表示“可以买到的/可供购买的”，也可指“能被金钱收买的/可被贿赂的”。

definition.en: Able to be bought; available for purchase.
definition.zh: 可以买到的；可供购买的。

examples.en: Is this model buyable online or only in stores?
examples.zh: 这个型号可以在网上买到，还是只能在店里买？

examples.en: The product isn’t buyable in my country yet.
examples.zh: 这个产品在我所在的国家还买不到。

definition.en: (Often negative) Able to be influenced or bribed with money; corruptible.
definition.zh: （常用于否定）能被金钱收买的；可被贿赂的；容易腐化的。

examples.en: She refused the offer and proved she wasn’t buyable.
examples.zh: 她拒绝了那个提议，证明她不是能被收买的人。

examples.en: We need leaders who are not buyable.
examples.zh: 我们需要不受金钱收买的领导者。

extraExplanation: “buyable”更常见于口语、商业语境或广告文案里，意思是“可购买的”。更正式的写法常用“available for purchase / purchasable”。
表示“能被收买的”这个意思时，语气通常比较强，带有道德批评色彩；更常见的同义表达还有“bribable / corruptible”。

summary.en: A buyback is the act or plan of buying something back—most commonly a company repurchasing its own shares.
summary.zh: buyback 指“回购”，最常见是公司回购本公司股票；也可指商家/政府等的产品回购计划。

definition.en: the act of buying something back, especially when a company repurchases its own shares from investors
definition.zh: 回购；（尤指公司）回购本公司股票

examples.en: The board approved a $2 billion share buyback.
examples.zh: 董事会批准了一项20亿美元的股票回购计划。

examples.en: A large buyback can reduce the number of shares on the market.
examples.zh: 大规模回购可能会减少市场上的流通股数量。

definition.en: a program in which a store or maker buys back a product from customers (often for cash, credit, or recycling)
definition.zh: （商家/厂家）产品回购计划（常以现金、购物金或回收为目的）

examples.en: The phone company offers a buyback for used devices.
examples.zh: 这家手机公司为旧设备提供回购服务。

examples.en: The government announced a gun buyback program.
examples.zh: 政府宣布了一项枪支回购计划。

extraExplanation: 在金融新闻里，buyback 常特指“股票回购（share buyback）”。公司回购股票后，可能会注销或留作库存股，从而影响每股收益（EPS）与股价表现。投资者也会把回购视为公司认为股价被低估、或公司手上现金充裕的一种信号，但并不一定总是利好。

summary.en: “Buybacks” most commonly means a company repurchasing its own shares; it can also mean any general buyback/repurchase program.
summary.zh: “Buybacks”最常指公司回购自家股票；也可泛指对已售出物品的回购/回收项目。

definition.en: A company’s repurchase of its own shares from the market (often to return cash to shareholders or reduce the number of shares outstanding).
definition.zh: （公司）回购股票：公司从市场上买回自己发行的股票（常用于向股东返还现金或减少流通股数）。

examples.en: The company announced a $2 billion share buyback program.
examples.zh: 这家公司宣布了一项20亿美元的股票回购计划。

examples.en: Buybacks can increase earnings per share if the total number of shares goes down.
examples.zh: 如果总股数减少，股票回购可能会提高每股收益。

examples.en: Some critics say buybacks benefit shareholders more than employees.
examples.zh: 一些批评者认为，股票回购更多让股东受益，而不是员工。

definition.en: More generally, the act of buying something back that was previously sold or issued.
definition.zh: 更广义：把之前卖出或发放的东西再买回来。

examples.en: The store offered a buyback of used textbooks at the end of the semester.
examples.zh: 这家商店在学期末提供旧教材回购服务。

examples.en: The city started a gun buyback to encourage safer communities.
examples.zh: 该市启动了枪支回购项目，以促进社区更安全。

extraExplanation: 在财经新闻里，buyback 和 share repurchase 基本同义；buyback program（回购计划）常指公司授权在一段时间内回购一定金额/数量的股票。
常见搭配：announce/launch a buyback（宣布/启动回购）、conduct buybacks（实施回购）、halt/suspend buybacks（暂停回购）。
语气/立场：buybacks 在英语媒体中有时带争议色彩，讨论点包括“是否推高股价”“是否挤占研发或员工福利”等。

summary.en: A “buycott” is a campaign to show support by buying something (the opposite idea of a boycott).
summary.zh: “buycott”指通过购买来表达支持的行动，理念上与“boycott（抵制）”相对。

definition.en: an organized effort to show support for a company, product, or cause by buying from it (often as a response to a boycott).
definition.zh: “以购买来支持”的集体行动：通过购买某公司/产品/事业来表达支持（常作为对“抵制 boycott”的回应）。

examples.en: Some customers started a buycott to support local farmers.
examples.zh: 一些顾客发起“buycott”，通过购买来支持本地农民。

examples.en: After the controversy, fans organized a buycott of the brand’s products.
examples.zh: 争议之后，粉丝组织了对该品牌产品的“buycott”（用购买来表达支持）。

definition.en: to support a company, product, or cause intentionally by purchasing it, often as part of a group campaign.
definition.zh: （常指集体行动中）通过刻意购买来支持某公司/产品/事业。

examples.en: People decided to buycott the store after it donated to disaster relief.
examples.zh: 人们决定通过购买来支持那家商店，因为它向救灾捐款。

examples.en: If you disagree with the boycott, you can buycott instead.
examples.zh: 如果你不同意抵制（boycott），你也可以选择“buycott”（用购买来支持）。

extraExplanation: “buycott”是由“buy + boycott”构成的混成词（portmanteau），意思可以理解为“用钱包投票（vote with your wallet）”的一种方式：不是拒买，而是特意去买来表达立场。
语域上比较偏新闻/社交媒体与行动主义（activism）语境，正式写作中有时会用更清楚的说法，如“support by purchasing”或“a pro-buying campaign”。

summary.en: Buyeo usually refers to an ancient Korean kingdom; it can also mean Buyeo County in South Korea.
summary.zh: Buyeo 通常指古代「扶餘」王國；也可指韓國忠清南道的「扶餘郡」。

definition.en: An ancient Korean kingdom in Manchuria and northern Korea (c. 2nd century BCE–494 CE), known as a predecessor influence on later states such as Goguryeo and Baekje.
definition.zh: 扶餘（Buyeo）：古代韓國（朝鮮）王國之一，主要活動於滿洲與朝鮮半島北部（約公元前2世紀至公元494年），被認為對後來的高句麗、百濟等政權有重要影響。

examples.en: Buyeo is often mentioned in discussions of the early origins of Korean kingdoms.
examples.zh: 在討論韓國古代王國起源時，扶餘常被提及。

examples.en: Some historical records link Buyeo culturally and politically with early Goguryeo.
examples.zh: 一些史料把扶餘在文化與政治上與早期高句麗聯繫起來。

definition.en: A county (and the name of its central town) in South Chungcheong Province, South Korea, known for Baekje-era history and archaeological sites.
definition.zh: 韓國忠清南道的扶餘郡（以及其中心城鎮之名），以百濟時期的歷史與考古遺址聞名。

examples.en: We visited Buyeo to see Baekje heritage sites and museums.
examples.zh: 我們去扶餘參觀百濟文化遺址和博物館。

examples.en: Buyeo County is a popular destination for learning about ancient Korean history.
examples.zh: 扶餘郡是了解韓國古代史的熱門地點。

extraExplanation: 「Buyeo」也常見於不同拼寫／轉寫：如「Puyŏ」（較舊的轉寫）或「Buyeo」（現代常見的韓式羅馬拼音）。在英語文章中，語境通常會告訴你指的是「古代扶餘王國」還是「韓國的扶餘郡」。
文獻中常見的相關國名有：Goguryeo（高句麗）、Baekje（百濟）、Silla（新羅）。談到扶餘時，常會一起出現，因為它在早期東北亞史脈絡中很重要。

summary.en: A buyer is a person or company that purchases something, especially in a transaction or contract.
summary.zh: Buyer 指购买某物的个人或公司，常用于交易或合同语境。

definition.en: A person or company that buys something.
definition.zh: 买家；购买者（个人或公司）。

examples.en: The buyer paid in cash.
examples.zh: 买家用现金付款。

examples.en: We’re looking for a buyer for the used car.
examples.zh: 我们在为这辆二手车寻找买家。

examples.en: Buyers compare prices online before they decide.
examples.zh: 买家会先在网上比较价格再决定。

definition.en: (Business/Law) The party who agrees to purchase goods, services, or property in a deal or contract.
definition.zh: （商务/法律）交易或合同中同意购买商品、服务或财产的一方（购买方）。

examples.en: The buyer must sign the contract by Friday.
examples.zh: 购买方必须在周五前签署合同。

examples.en: The seller delivered the goods to the buyer’s warehouse.
examples.zh: 卖方将货物送到买方仓库。

extraExplanation: “buyer”常用于正式或交易语境，强调“购买行为/身份”；“customer”更强调“顾客”与商家之间的服务关系（尤其在商店、餐饮等场景）。例如：online buyers（网购买家）很自然；in a restaurant 通常说 customer（顾客）。
相关常见搭配：buyer’s market（买方市场）、serious buyer（诚意买家/真心要买的人）、prospective buyer（潜在买家）、buyer beware（买者自负：提醒消费者要谨慎）。

summary.en: A buyer is a person or organization that purchases something, especially in a transaction where there is also a seller.
summary.zh: buyer 指购买某物的个人或机构，尤指交易中与卖方相对的“买方/买家”。

definition.en: A person, company, or group that buys something (goods, services, or property).
definition.zh: 买方；购买者（个人、公司或团体，购买商品、服务或房产等）。

examples.en: The buyer paid in cash.
examples.zh: 买家用现金付款。

examples.en: We’re looking for a buyer for the house.
examples.zh: 我们在为这套房子寻找买家。

examples.en: The seller and the buyer signed the contract.
examples.zh: 卖方和买方签了合同。

definition.en: A customer or potential customer, especially in business or marketing contexts.
definition.zh: （尤指商业/营销语境中的）顾客；潜在购买者。

examples.en: This discount attracts new buyers.
examples.zh: 这个折扣吸引新顾客。

examples.en: They interviewed buyers to understand what people want.
examples.zh: 他们采访了购买者，以了解人们想要什么。

extraExplanation: “buyer”常与“seller（卖方）”成对出现；在法律或合同语境中也常用“buyer”指“买方”。在日常口语里，谈到买东西的人也可以说“customer（顾客）”，但“buyer”更强调“购买行为/交易角色”，而“customer”更强调“与商家的关系与服务体验”。
常见搭配：buyer’s market（买方市场，买家更占优势）、buyer beware（买者自慎/买者当心，提醒购买前要仔细检查）、first-time buyer（首次购房/首次购买者）、serious buyer（诚意买家）。

summary.en: A market that favors buyers, with more supply and easier price negotiation.
summary.zh: 有利于买家的市场：供应更充足、价格更好谈。

definition.en: A market situation where there are many sellers (or a large supply) and relatively few buyers, so prices tend to be lower and buyers have more power to negotiate.
definition.zh: 买方市场：卖家多或供应充足、买家相对较少，因此价格往往较低，买家更有议价优势。

examples.en: With so many apartments available, it’s a buyer’s market and landlords are offering discounts.
examples.zh: 公寓供应很多，现在是买方市场，房东还在给折扣。

examples.en: In a buyer’s market, you can take your time and negotiate the price.
examples.zh: 在买方市场里，你可以慢慢挑、并且和对方砍价。

examples.en: Car dealers lowered prices because the economy turned it into a buyer’s market.
examples.zh: 因为经济形势变化，市场变成买方市场，汽车经销商下调了价格。

extraExplanation: 常见对比：buyer’s market（供大于求，买家占优势） vs. seller’s market（供不应求，卖家占优势）。
常见语境（尤其在美国）：房地产新闻里会说“housing is a buyer’s market / seller’s market”。
语言点：buyer’s 是所有格（= market for buyers），读写时要有撇号 s。
etymology: 源自经济学与商业英语的“buyer（买方）+ market（市场）”搭配，用来对比“seller’s market（卖方市场）”。常见于房地产、汽车、二手商品等供需变化明显的领域。
mnemonic: 把它当成“买家的市场”：看到 buyer’s 就想“买方占便宜、好砍价”。
联想中文固定搭配“买方市场/卖方市场”，一一对应即可。

summary.en: Buyer-dominant describes a market or negotiation where buyers have the advantage over sellers.
summary.zh: buyer-dominant 指买方在市场或谈判中占优势、议价能力更强。

definition.en: In a situation (especially a market or negotiation) where buyers have more power than sellers, so buyers can demand lower prices or better terms.
definition.zh: （尤指市场或谈判中）买方力量强于卖方，买方更有议价权，因此能要求更低价格或更优条款。

examples.en: In a buyer-dominant housing market, sellers often accept offers below the asking price.
examples.zh: 在买方主导的房市里，卖家常常会接受低于开价的出价。

examples.en: The contract was written on buyer-dominant terms, with long warranty periods and easy returns.
examples.zh: 这份合同采用买方主导的条款，包含较长的保修期和更容易退货的规定。

extraExplanation: “buyer-dominant”常用于商业/经济语境，含义接近“buyer’s market（买方市场）”。常见判断信号：供给相对充足、竞争卖家多、库存高、成交周期变长、折扣增多等。
也可用于谈判关系而不仅是整体市场：例如当买家掌握关键渠道、订单量大或可轻易转向替代供应商时，就可能形成buyer-dominant的议价格局。

summary.en: Buyer-dominated means buyers have more power than sellers in a market or negotiation.
summary.zh: buyer-dominated 指在市场或谈判中买方比卖方更有主导权。

definition.en: Controlled mainly by buyers rather than sellers; used to describe a market or situation where buyers have more power (for example, more choices, lower prices, stronger negotiating position).
definition.zh: 由买方主导的；用于描述一种市场或局面：买方比卖方更有主导权（例如选择更多、价格更低、议价能力更强）。

examples.en: In a buyer-dominated market, companies often cut prices to attract customers.
examples.zh: 在买方主导的市场里，公司往往会降价来吸引顾客。

examples.en: Because supply is high, the housing market feels buyer-dominated this year.
examples.zh: 由于供应充足，今年的房地产市场更像是买方主导。

examples.en: Negotiations were buyer-dominated, so the seller accepted a lower offer.
examples.zh: 谈判由买方主导，因此卖方接受了更低的出价。

extraExplanation: “buyer-dominated”常见于商业、经济与谈判语境，强调“权力/话语权在买方”。与之非常接近的常用表达是“buyer’s market（买方市场）”，而相反的概念是“seller-dominated”或“seller’s market（卖方市场）”。
写作上它通常作定语（a buyer-dominated market）或表语（the market is buyer-dominated）。连字符表示这是一个合成形容词。

summary.en: “Buyers” means people or organizations who buy something (plural of buyer).
summary.zh: “Buyers”指“买家/买方”，是 buyer 的复数，表示购买某物的人或机构。

definition.en: People or organizations that buy goods, services, or property; the plural form of “buyer.”
definition.zh: 买家；购买商品、服务或房产的人或机构（buyer 的复数）。

examples.en: The store is offering discounts to attract more buyers.
examples.zh: 这家店正在打折以吸引更多买家。

examples.en: There were several buyers interested in the apartment.
examples.zh: 有好几个买家对这套公寓感兴趣。

examples.en: Online buyers often compare prices before ordering.
examples.zh: 网购者常常在下单前比较价格。

extraExplanation: 在商业语境中，buyer 指“采购/买方”，不仅是普通消费者，也可以是公司里负责采购的人。常见搭配：buyers and sellers（买方与卖方）、buyers market（买方市场，买家更有议价优势）。

summary.en: “Buyers” means people or groups who buy something; it’s the plural of “buyer.”
summary.zh: “buyers”指购买某物的人或机构，是“buyer”的复数。

definition.en: People or organizations that purchase goods, services, or property.
definition.zh: 购买商品、服务或房产的人或机构；买方。

examples.en: The buyers compared prices before choosing a laptop.
examples.zh: 买家在选择笔记本电脑之前比较了价格。

examples.en: The house attracted many buyers during the open house.
examples.zh: 在开放看房时，这套房子吸引了很多买家。

extraExplanation: “buyers”是名词“buyer”的复数形式，常见于商业、市场营销和房地产语境。
常见搭配：potential buyers（潜在买家）、first-time buyers（首次购房者/首次购买者）、serious buyers（有诚意的买家）、buyers’ market（买方市场，供给大、买家更有议价能力）。
注意区分：buyer（买方）强调“购买的一方”，customer（顾客）强调“与商家建立消费关系的人”，在零售语境中两者常可互换，但在合同/贸易中buyer更正式。

summary.en: Buy-side: investors and investment firms that buy securities; also used as an adjective for that investor side of finance.
summary.zh: Buy-side：金融中的“买方”，指购买证券的投资者/机构；也可作形容词表示“买方的”。

definition.en: (Finance) The part of the financial market made up of investors who buy securities, such as asset managers, mutual funds, pension funds, and hedge funds.
definition.zh: （金融）“买方”：金融市场中以购买证券为主的投资方，如资产管理公司、公募基金、养老金、对冲基金等。

examples.en: She works on the buy-side, managing a fund’s investments.
examples.zh: 她在买方工作，负责管理基金的投资。

examples.en: Buy-side analysts focus on finding opportunities to earn returns for clients.
examples.zh: 买方分析师专注于寻找为客户赚钱的投资机会。

definition.en: Related to investors or investment firms that purchase securities (not the firms that sell them).
definition.zh: 与买方投资者或投资机构有关的（区别于卖方机构）。

examples.en: He moved from a sell-side bank to a buy-side role.
examples.zh: 他从卖方投行跳槽到了买方岗位。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“Buyides”更像是拼写错误；常见词是 buy-side（也写作 buy side）。在金融语境里，sell-side（卖方）通常指券商/投行提供研究与交易服务；buy-side（买方）则是使用资金进行投资、目标是获取回报的一方。
常见搭配：buy-side firm（买方机构）、buy-side analyst（买方分析师）、buy-side client（买方客户）。

summary.en: “buyides” is not a standard English word; it’s probably a typo (e.g., “buy ideas,” “bodies,” or “buoyed”).
summary.zh: “buyides”不是标准英语单词，可能是拼写错误（如“buy ideas”“bodies”或“buoyed”）。

definition.en: Not a standard English word. It is likely a misspelling or a mistyped phrase (for example, “buy ideas,” “bodies,” or “buoyed”).
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词。更可能是拼写或输入错误（例如“buy ideas”“bodies”或“buoyed”等）。

examples.en: Did you mean “buy ideas” (purchase suggestions) or “bodies” (people/physical forms)?
examples.zh: 你是想写“buy ideas”（购买/获取点子）还是“bodies”（身体/人）？

examples.en: If you meant “buoyed,” you could say: “She was buoyed by the good news.”
examples.zh: 如果你想写“buoyed”，可以说：“She was buoyed by the good news.”（好消息让她振作起来。）

extraExplanation: “buyides”本身不属于常见英语词汇，也不是常见固定搭配。为了更准确解释，请你告诉我：你是在什么句子里看到/想用这个词？或你想表达的中文意思是什么（比如“振作”“身体”“点子/想法”等）？我就能帮你锁定正确单词并给出用法。

summary.en: “Buying” most commonly means purchasing (as an action or the act of shopping). In spoken English, it can also mean believing or accepting a claim (“I’m not buying it.”).
summary.zh: “Buying”最常见意思是“购买/购物（的行为）”，口语中也可表示“相信、接受某种说法”（如 I’m not buying it. 我不信）。

definition.en: the act of getting something by paying money; shopping or purchasing
definition.zh: 购买；买东西（花钱取得物品或服务的行为）

examples.en: Online buying is convenient, but always check the return policy.
examples.zh: 网购很方便，但一定要查看退货政策。

examples.en: Impulse buying can lead to spending more than you planned.
examples.zh: 冲动消费可能会让你花超预算。

definition.en: present participle of “buy”: purchasing something with money
definition.zh: buy 的现在分词：正在购买；用钱买

examples.en: I’m buying groceries after work.
examples.zh: 我下班后要去买杂货。

examples.en: She’s buying a used car to save money.
examples.zh: 她买二手车来省钱。

definition.en: accepting or believing an idea or excuse (often used in negatives: “not buying it”)
definition.zh: 相信/接受某种说法或借口（常用于否定：not buying it 不信）

examples.en: I’m not buying his excuse for being late.
examples.zh: 我不相信他迟到的借口。

examples.en: They aren’t buying the company’s explanation.
examples.zh: 他们不买公司的解释（不相信）。

extraExplanation: “Buying”除了字面“购买”，口语里也常表示“相信、接受（某种说法）”。例如：I’m not buying it. = 我不信/我不吃这一套。语气通常带怀疑或不认同。
名词用法 “buying” 常见于搭配：impulse buying（冲动消费）、bulk buying（批量采购）、panic buying（恐慌性抢购）。

summary.en: Patterns and reasons behind how people purchase goods or services.
summary.zh: 人们购买商品或服务的模式与原因。

definition.en: The way people choose, purchase, and use products or services, including the reasons behind those choices (often studied in marketing).
definition.zh: 人们选择、购买并使用产品或服务的方式与原因（常用于市场营销研究）。

examples.en: Brands study buying behavior to understand why customers choose one product over another.
examples.zh: 品牌研究购买行为，以了解顾客为何选择某个产品而不是另一个。

examples.en: Online reviews can strongly influence buying behavior.
examples.zh: 线上评价会强烈影响购买行为。

examples.en: Her buying behavior changed after she started comparing prices on apps.
examples.zh: 她开始用应用比价后，购买行为发生了变化。

definition.en: A person’s or group’s buying habits and patterns, such as how often they buy, how much they spend, and where they shop.
definition.zh: 个人或群体的购买习惯与模式，例如购买频率、花费金额以及购物渠道。

examples.en: Their buying behavior shows they prefer to shop on weekends.
examples.zh: 他们的购买行为显示他们更喜欢周末购物。

examples.en: The store tracked buying behavior to plan inventory.
examples.zh: 商店追踪购买行为来规划库存。

extraExplanation: 在市场营销中，buying behavior 常与“影响因素”一起讨论：价格、品牌、情绪、同伴影响、文化、便利性、广告、促销等。
常见搭配：consumer buying behavior（消费者购买行为）, buying behavior analysis（购买行为分析）, change/influence buying behavior（改变/影响购买行为）, purchase behavior（购买行为，近义但更偏“购买动作/过程”）。
etymology: “buying”来自动词 buy（购买）；“behavior”来自 behave（表现、举止），表示“行为方式”。合起来在商业语境中固定用来指“购买相关的行为与动机”。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：buying（买）+ behavior（行为）= “买东西时的行为/模式”。
联想中文“消费行为/购买习惯”，基本就是 buying behavior。

summary.en: choices about what to purchase and how to purchase it
summary.zh: 关于购买什么以及如何购买的选择

definition.en: choices people make about whether to purchase something, what to purchase, and how/when/where to purchase it
definition.zh: 关于是否购买、买什么、何时/在哪里/如何购买等方面所做的选择

examples.en: Online reviews strongly influence buying decisions.
examples.zh: 线上评价会强烈影响购买决策。

examples.en: Price is important, but trust in the brand also shapes buying decisions.
examples.zh: 价格很重要，但对品牌的信任也会影响购买决策。

examples.en: The company studied customers’ buying decisions to improve its marketing.
examples.zh: 公司研究了顾客的购买决策，以改进营销。

extraExplanation: 在市场营销语境里，buying decisions 常与 factors（因素）一起出现，如 price（价格）、quality（质量）、convenience（便利性）、brand reputation（品牌口碑）、social proof（社会认同/从众线索）等。
与 purchase decision(s) 意思接近，但 purchase 更正式、更偏书面；buying 更日常、更口语化。
etymology: 由现在分词 buying（buy 的进行形式，表示“购买行为”）+ 名词 decisions（decision 的复数，表示“决定/决策”）构成，常用于商业、市场营销和消费者行为领域。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：buying=“买的行为”，decisions=“决定”；合起来就是“关于买不买、怎么买的决定”。
联想中文“决策”常见搭配：购买+决策=购买决策（几乎一一对应）。

summary.en: how much money can actually buy in goods and services
summary.zh: 货币能实际购买到多少商品或服务的能力

definition.en: the amount of goods or services that money can buy; the real value of money, often affected by prices and inflation
definition.zh: 购买力；指货币能买到多少商品或服务的能力（真实价值），常受物价和通货膨胀影响

examples.en: Because of inflation, her salary has less buying power than it did five years ago.
examples.zh: 由于通货膨胀，她的工资购买力比五年前更弱了。

examples.en: The central bank raised interest rates to protect the dollar’s buying power.
examples.zh: 央行加息以保护美元的购买力。

examples.en: This chart compares the buying power of the same income in different cities.
examples.zh: 这张图比较了同一收入在不同城市的购买力。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：increase/boost buying power（提高购买力）、lose buying power（购买力下降）、protect/preserve buying power（保持购买力）、consumer buying power（消费者购买力）。
与 purchasing power 基本同义；在经济学和新闻里更常见的是 purchasing power（如 purchasing power parity, PPP：购买力平价）。
etymology: 由 buy（买）+ power（力量/能力）组成，字面意思是“购买的能力”。在经济学语境中固定指货币的“实际购买能力”，常与物价水平、通胀/通缩相联系。
mnemonic: 直译记忆：buy（买）+ power（能力）＝“能买多少”的能力＝购买力。
联想“通胀让钱‘变小’”：价格涨→同样的钱买得更少→buying power 下降。

summary.en: Buymanship means the skill of buying wisely—getting good value, quality, or terms.
summary.zh: Buymanship 指精明购买/善于采购的能力，强调买得划算、质量好或条件谈得好。

definition.en: Skill in buying goods or services wisely, especially getting good quality or good prices; smart purchasing or procurement.
definition.zh: 精明的购买技巧；善于采购（尤其指买到物美价廉或谈到好条件的能力）。

examples.en: Her buymanship helps the team get reliable supplies without overspending.
examples.zh: 她的采购本领帮助团队在不超支的情况下买到可靠的物资。

examples.en: Good buymanship means comparing prices and checking reviews before you pay.
examples.zh: 好的购买技巧就是付款前先比价、看评价。

extraExplanation: “buymanship”是比较少见的词，多用于商务/采购语境，常见搭配是“good buymanship”（精明采购）。日常口语里更常说“smart shopping / purchasing skills / procurement skills”。
构词上由“buy + -manship”组成，类似“sportsmanship（体育精神/风度）”“craftsmanship（手艺）”，强调“在某件事上的本领/素养”。

summary.en: A buyout is either (1) the acquisition of a company/control by buying shares, or (2) money paid to end a contract early.
summary.zh: buyout 可指（1）通过买入股份实现对公司/控制权的收购；也可指（2）为提前解除合同而支付的买断金/解约补偿。

definition.en: the purchase of a company (or a large part of it), or the act of buying out owners’ shares so one party gains control
definition.zh: （公司等的）收购；（通过买下股份使一方获得控制权的）买断

examples.en: The private equity firm led a buyout of the retail chain.
examples.zh: 这家私募股权公司主导了对该零售连锁的收购。

examples.en: After the buyout, the company changed its management team.
examples.zh: 收购完成后，公司更换了管理团队。

examples.en: Employees worried about layoffs after the buyout.
examples.zh: 员工担心收购后会裁员。

definition.en: an agreement to pay someone to end a contract or give up a right (often a job contract)
definition.zh: （为结束合同或放弃权利而支付的）买断金；解约补偿

examples.en: He accepted a buyout to leave the company early.
examples.zh: 他接受了买断金，提前离开了公司。

examples.en: The team offered the coach a buyout of his contract.
examples.zh: 球队向教练提供了解约补偿。

extraExplanation:
在商业新闻里，buyout 常见于两类搭配：
1) management buyout (MBO) 指“管理层收购”，即公司管理层把公司从原股东手里买下来；
2) leveraged buyout (LBO) 指“杠杆收购”，即主要靠借款来完成收购。
这些术语常见于财经报道，但日常口语里更常用的是“buyout = 收购/买断金”。

summary.en: Buyouts are purchases that take full/controlling ownership of a business or pay to end an agreement early.
summary.zh: Buyouts 指“收购”（取得公司/控股权）或“买断/解约补偿”（付费提前终止协议）。

definition.en: the purchase of a company, business, or a controlling share of it (often used in business and finance)
definition.zh: （商业/金融）收购：买下公司、业务，或其控股权

examples.en: The private equity firm announced a buyout of the retail chain.
examples.zh: 这家私募股权公司宣布收购这家零售连锁店。

examples.en: After the buyout, the company changed its management team.
examples.zh: 收购完成后，公司更换了管理团队。

definition.en: a payment to end an agreement early by buying someone’s rights or obligations (for example, a contract, lease, or job arrangement)
definition.zh: （合同）买断费/解约补偿：付钱提前终止协议，买下对方的权利或义务（如合同、租约、雇佣安排）

examples.en: The landlord offered a buyout to end the lease early.
examples.zh: 房东提出支付买断费以提前终止租约。

examples.en: Some employees accepted a buyout and left the company voluntarily.
examples.zh: 一些员工接受了买断补偿，自愿离开公司。

extraExplanation: “buyout(s)”是名词；动词形式常写作短语“buy out”（买下、收购、买断）。例如：They bought out their partner.（他们买下了合伙人的股份。）
在新闻里常见“LBO”（leveraged buyout，杠杆收购）：收购方借很多钱来完成收购，之后用被收购公司的现金流来还债。理解这一点有助于看懂商业报道。
职场语境中的“employee buyout”通常指公司给一笔补偿，鼓励员工自愿离职；语气比“layoff”（裁员）更“温和”，但本质仍是减少人员成本。

summary.en: “Buys” is the third-person singular present of “buy,” meaning to purchase something; informally, it can also mean “believes.”
summary.zh: “buys”是“buy”的一般现在时第三人称单数，意思是“购买”；口语中也可表示“相信（某说法）”。

definition.en: third-person singular present form of “buy”: to get something by paying money for it.
definition.zh: “buy”的一般现在时第三人称单数：用钱购买某物。

examples.en: She buys groceries every Saturday.
examples.zh: 她每个星期六都买日用品。

examples.en: He buys a new phone when his old one breaks.
examples.zh: 他的旧手机坏了就会买新的。

definition.en: (informal) to believe something, especially a story or excuse.
definition.zh: （非正式）相信某事，尤其是相信一个说法或借口。

examples.en: I don’t buy his excuse.
examples.zh: 我不相信他的借口。

examples.en: Do you really buy that story?
examples.zh: 你真的相信那个说法吗？

extraExplanation: “buys”常见在一般现在时里，表示习惯/规律动作（She buys…）。如果主语是 I/you/we/they，就用 buy；主语是 he/she/it 才用 buys。
口语里“buy”=“相信”很常用，常是否定：I don’t buy it.（我不吃这套/我不信。）语气比“I don’t believe it”更随意。

summary.en: Buyse is mainly used as a surname (last name).
summary.zh: Buyse 主要用作姓氏（英文里的 last name）。

definition.en: a family name (surname), most often found in Dutch/Flemish-speaking areas; used as someone’s last name.
definition.zh: 姓氏（家族名）；多见于荷兰语/佛兰芒语地区，用作人的姓。

examples.en: My professor’s last name is Buyse.
examples.zh: 我教授的姓是 Buyse。

examples.en: Ms. Buyse will lead the meeting today.
examples.zh: Buyse 女士今天将主持会议。

synonyms: (no true synonyms; it is a proper name)
extraExplanation: Buyse 通常被认为是佛兰芒（比利时北部）/荷兰语圈常见的姓氏之一。作为专有名词，它本身没有“词义”，主要用于指代某个家族或个人。
英语环境中它的读音可能会被英语化；如果你是在特定国家/场合（例如比利时学校、公司或文件）看到，最好参考当事人或当地的标准读法。
